characters: PULLING THE TWINE SO THAT ALL THE PINS POP OUT OF THE BOA
JULIAN AND HIMSELF, EXHILARATED, WORKING ON JULIUS BAER.
MILITARY, SOME U.S. STATE DEPARTMENT, ALL MARKED CLASSIFI
THE FLYERS FALL, SCATTERING ALL AROUND JULIAN.
AND THROWS IT UP ON ONE OF THE WALLS. MOCK UPS ARE QUICKL
DOLLY AROUND A SERIES OF DESKS/COMPUTERS IN RAPID
SMASH BACK TO THE EDS STORE ROOM
JAMES BOSWELL, ASSISTANT SECRETARY OF STATE FOR DIPLOMATI
MARKED UP, PULLED DOWN, PUT BACK UP...
CLOUDS ON THE CAYMAN TAX HEAVEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A looming modern structure, steel and glass, home of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: July 2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guardian - London, England

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whisper builds, pushing us into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A low buzz, a hustle of activity, journalists swirling. REPORTER NICK DAVIES, 50s, handsome, hustles along with RUMPLED EDITOR ALAN RUSBRIDGER, 50s. Alan's on a blackber

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we hold the shooting in Kabul we can keep it all to 14 pages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass ONE SHEETS tacked to the wall, we note the FRON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off his blackberry) The Times wants to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan glances over at Nick.   Nick frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me talk to Rosenbach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quiet room. CLOSE ON a laptop screen, The Guardian website, no mention of the Afghan War Logs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cursor moves, hits the REFRESH BUTTON. The screen refreshes. Nothing's changed. The cursor HITS the button again. The screen refreshes, again it's the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the cursor hits the button AGAIN --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SMALL BUILDING overshadowed by an array of GRAND MODERNITY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Der Spiegel - Berlin, Germany

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rumble of German voices take us into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small office, ICONIC SPIEGEL COVERS on the walls. A BUTTONED UP EDITOR, STARK, 40s, stands over a PROGRAMMER working on the front page of SPIEGEL ONLINE. An English headline -- AMERICA'S SECRET WAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't want to have to scroll down for the Task Force 373 story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holger, I've got Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stark turns. A DISHEVELED REPORTER, ROSENBACH, stands in door with a laptop. Nick in an open Skype window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleading, IN ENGLISH) Five minutes. Five more minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a hand holding down the SHIFT KEY. RACK FOCUS to the other hand, clicking a MOUSE over and over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EYES covered with THICK BLACK GLASSES. In their REFLECTIO we see the screen. Refreshing again. Still the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The familiar TIMES LOGO sprawled across a SLICK NEW BUILDING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan, you said five o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small room, BILL KELLER stands over a TECH, reads a sto on a laptop, DEPUTIES crowded round. A SPEAKERPHONE squaw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ON SPEAKERPHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Bill, I know but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill NODS to the tech, he starts typing, taking the site live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deputies start to clear out as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick stands with Alan, on the phone, as AGITATED as he ge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ON THE PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Nick just spoke to Rosenbach, they need at least another few --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're live. The Times is live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan lowers the phone, turns to DEPUTY EDITOR IAN KATZ, 4 at a desktop. WE SEE the TIMES SITE live with THE WAR LOG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patience, humility, such cardinal American virtues...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated) Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nick rushes out of the office, Ian at his heels --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE'RE WIDER NOW, we see a dimly lit office CLUTTERED with routers, servers, network gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the middle of it all, the MAN IN GLASSES sits on a sto his back to us, staring at a laptop. He's SHIRTLESS... A HUGE UNFINISHED WIKILEAKS TATTOO stretches across his bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds shift, clicks the mouse, the site refreshes. He reaches for a mug, lifts it and PAUSES. Over his shoulder THE GUARDIAN SITE: SECRET FILES EXPOSE AFGHAN WAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANIEL BERG, 31. His beard UNKEMPT, a WEARY LOOK, complex emotions playing across his face as he stares at the scre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off his reaction, we SMASH TO A SERIES OF MEDIA CLIPS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WOLF BLITZER and others report on the leak of the AFGHAN LOGS. They show WAR FOOTAGE and pivot from military cover ups to the impact of Wikileaks on journalism, diplomacy, national security...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, a few reports suggest Wikileaks is about to rele HUNDREDS OF THOUSANDS OF STATE DEPARTMENT CABLES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obama speaks at the Rose Garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the disclosure could potentially jeopardize individuals or operations...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DESERT landscape, a jagged mountain backdrop, barren save for an oddly located COMPLEX of STERILE WHITE BUILDINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOUR SCIENTISTS in WHITE COATS walk through a WINDOWLESS CORRIDOR towards a MILITARY CHECKPOINT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A high speed camera will measure the explosive charge we've designed to trigger the chain reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The youngest, SIM SARNA, 40s, carries a pad. He speaks up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dimensions are consistent with the Shahab missile payload?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The older scientist nods as ARMED GUARDS check IDs, do a RETINAL SCAN and then wave them through into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A room of Iranian scientists. Sarna and his team walk in join them at a LARGE OBSERVATION WINDOW that looks out on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HUGE SUBTERRANEAN COMPLEX. Technicians scurry around a large, cylindrical containment vessel surrounded by high speed cameras and cocooned with fiber-optic cables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarna spots a BLUEPRINT with NUCLEAR SYMBOLS on the wall. Teller-Ulam design for a NUCLEAR BOMB. Sarna opens his pa to take notes when a GENERAL walks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, if you'll follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to lead them into the main complex when Sarna's cell RINGS. He checks the ID and HOLDS BACK. CONFUSED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ANSWERING THE PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Sim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN on his face as his EYES GO WIDE. A beat, then try to remain calm, Sarna heads for the exit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sim? They're detonating in fifteen minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... left my log book in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he turns, we SMASH TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CAR barrels down the two lane road that cuts through th desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we spot Sarna, FREAKED, at the wheel, SMASH TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarna's PALE and SWEATING, eyes filled with FEAR as he SWERVES past slower moving vehicles. The car SCREECHES ro a corner, SPEEDS down a residential block and SLAMS into driveway of a PRETTY TWO STORY HOUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarna BLOWS out of the car and we PULL BACK to... A LONG LENS tracking Sarna racing into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two IRANIAN MEN IN SUITS in an unmarked sedan. WATCHING. pulls back his jacket, reaches for a HOLSTERED GUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A well appointed kitchen. Sarna's young wife SHIDA is in modern dress and sings to a baby in her arms. Behind her, MAID IN A BURKA cooks. [ALL IN FARSI WITH SUBTITLES].

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarna RUSHES in, PALE, SWEATING. He turns to the maid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's cooking dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now! She needs to go now, Shida!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The maid exits quickly. Shida turns, CONFUSED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to pack. Everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarna's wife PALES as we hear a KNOCK at the door. Sarna turns. Through the window, we see the TWO MEN IN SUITS. LOOMING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Sarna, TERRIFIED, we PRELAP --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any other sources we still need to notify in the Middle East?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blocky, limestone architecture of Foggy Bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The State Department, Washington D.C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: URGENT, AGITATED AMERICAN VOICES pull us into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chaotic swirl of TENSE DIPLOMATS on phones and BlackBerrys, sifting through a MOUNTAIN of dossiers all marked CONFIDENTIAL -- the fabled DIPLOMATIC CABLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qaddafi's body man is one of ours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIND a DIPLOMAT at a WHITE BOARD: A MAP, a LIST OF COUNTRIES, and NAMES OF SOURCES in two columns, NOTIFY or EXTRACT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulling him will torch the Ambassador.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STAFFER hands a file marked STRICTLY PROTECT to...

dialogues.speaker: JAMES BOSWELL, ASSISTANT SECRETARY OF STATE FOR DIPLOMATI
dialogues.text: SECURITY. BOSWELL, 62, has the wisdom and unflappable air someone who's been in the foreign service for over 30 yea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're pulling the Ambassador.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. How long do we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assange is talking to the press in an hour, let's not screw around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men react but Boswell's already MOVING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karzai's going apeshit, I need the Secretary to put in another call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG DIPLOMAT with a FEW CABLES catches up with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's still talking Cameron down, let me handle him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He TAKES the cables, moves past a BANK OF TVS -- CNN, FOX coverage of the leak -- and lands at a TABLE OF DOCUMENTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think the President of Turkmenistan will be more annoyed that I called him a practiced liar or that I called him vain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEPUTY UNDERSECRETARY OF STATE, SARAH SHAW, early 40s, ey a cable. Sarah's brittle, a searing intelligence that has always served well in the world of diplomacy and politics

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's heard worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) The President doesn't like people smarter than him. Since he's not very bright, he's suspicious of a lot of people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Berdymukhamedov has been around a while, he doesn't tend to worry about the opinions of mid-level foreign attaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off the cable) Yes, that's why I signed Hillary's name to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tight smile from Boswell. That could get Sarah fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see if the Times will hold it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got bigger issues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds out a LARGE STACK of cables. Boswell BALKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah, I'm collecting cables from the head of every foreign desk, I can't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you tell me what to ignore. (off a few cables) This could destroy the Sudanese peace talks, this screws a source in Cairo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Times will redact the names.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him? Will he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AGITATED, she eyes the TVs, each with a DIFFERENT IMAGE o JULIAN ASSANGE, ANGLED SHOTS so we can't see his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't tell me your buddy Keller's got him under control. Every news network on the planet is covering his press conference, he's bigger than the Times, he's going to do whatever the hell he wants. Just like he did with the war logs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boswell softens. CONCERNED --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any word on Sim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah shakes her head, WORRIED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 300 million people gave us the responsibility of deciding what's public. Who in God's name elected him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We push past her, towards the bank of tvs, towards the VAGUE, FRACTURED OF IMAGES of ASSANGE and we hear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love him or loathe him,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assange provokes debate --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian Assange is not your            average journalist --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some have argued he's not really a journalist at all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Push into a MONITOR -- MORE STOLEN GLIMPSES of Julian... putting on boots, hauling a backpack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The peripatetic internet muckraker is used to bounding...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATCH CUT TO A LAPTOP, STREAMING VIDEO from CBS and a COLLAGE of other NEWS SITES, all open to stories on the w logs. On the video, Julian pulls the wrapping off a new c phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...from city to city, regularly changing his cell phones, hairstyles and general appearance, he says to avoid surveillance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the BRITISH DOUBLE PURR of a recently placed phon call and FIND Daniel, AGITATED, phone to his ear. A shirt now, he rifles through a BACKPACK just like Julian's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Come on, pick up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel grabs a SECOND LAPTOP as the DOUBLE PURR takes us to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATCH SOUND TO A RINGING PHONE... in the hands of ZIGGY, 17-YEAR-OLD INTERN in a rear facing jump seat in the back a crowded cab. We spy a FRACTURED REFLECTION in the window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GLOWING LAPTOP SCREEN, a SHOCK OF WHITE HAIR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN WITH WHITE HAIR opposite Ziggy, hunched over his laptop. Beside him, the SAME BACKPACK as Daniel. We don't see his face, but we know it's JULIAN ASSANGE, 39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian waves him off. Ziggy SILENCES the phone as the cab pulls up in front of the FRONTLINE CLUB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The intern opens the door and we CUT INTO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRESS MILLING. Photos of soldiers on the wall, copies of Guardian everywhere -- MASSIVE LEAK EXPOSES TRUE AFGHAN W A BBC REPORTER stands near a PODIUM, doing a live feed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few months ago, most people had never heard of Wikileaks or its mysterious and eccentric founder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFF TO ONE SIDE, a small group of reporters congratulate Katz, now in GUARDIAN PRESS TAGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, he hears --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's here. / Assange is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ian looks up, spies Ziggy on the edge of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he starts to move, we hear a loud KNOCK and we SMASH T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel pulls open the door. MARCUS, 30s, a BEARDED HACKER with an IMPOSING PRESENCE, pushes in carrying a laptop ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel leads him to his desk, where several laptops are n up and running. Marcus pulls another out of his pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you reach him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Marcus pops open the laptop, Daniel glances at a TV. We see our BBC Reporter in the Frontline Club press room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Assange dismissed reports of internal dissention and defections

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel and Marcus trade a LOOK, Daniel moves to a laptop. see the WIKILEAKS SITE and an OPEN CHAT BOX. Daniel TYPES ddd: Julian? Are you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATCH CUT TO ANOTHER LAPTOP. A CHAT pops up in a CHAT BOX ddd: Julian? Are you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next to the chat, a collage of PAUSED VIDEO CLIPS and ONL ARTICLES... all about Assange. REVEAL Julian, back to us, typing a speech on a second laptop. Julian pauses, looks the chat box, IGNORES it, but glances over at the ARTICLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ian Katz walks in and peers over Julian's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man points to the moon and the idiots look at his finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I suppose we'll have to give them the moon again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian smiles up at Ian. It's the first time we've gotten good look at him. And he's fucking MAGNETIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian takes the laptop he was working on and exits. HOLD the other laptop. On Daniel's BLINKING MESSAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian shuffles to the podium, Ian behind him. The press hushes as Julian opens up his laptop. He pauses, looks ou at the crowd, TAKING IN THE MOMENT. A beat, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If journalism is good it is controversial by its nature...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATCH CUT TO Julian on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus and Daniel watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, powerful abusers always attempt to criticise the messenger--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Julian speaks, we PUSH IN on Daniel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ON THE MONITOR)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to distract from the power of the message...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel. If you want to do this, we need to do it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel turns back towards his laptop. As he rubs his eyes we push past him, to the laptop screen, the blinking curs ddd: Julian?   Are you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN as faint ELECTRONICA starts WHISPERING, PULSING.. Suddenly, THE LETTERS CHANGE FROM GREEN TO WHITE. SLAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White letters on black. Tinny electronica a little louder ddd: Julian? Are you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to REVEAL another computer screen. Another chat box. And a man wearing HUGE BLACK HEADPHONES. SPIN TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNGER DANIEL BERG, now 28, in a CATASTROPHE OF A CUBICLE. FILES everywhere, a DIRT BIKE against the wall, desk littered with BOTTLES of CLUB MATE energy cola, WILL GIBSON NOVELS, CALL OF CTHULHU BOOKS, an odd ANTENNA made PRINGLES CANS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: December 2007

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Electronic Data Systems - Berlin, Germany

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel's in T-SHIRT and JEANS, CLEAN SHAVEN, no world wea to his mien... a YOUTHFUL LIGHT in his eyes as he looks hopefully at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE SCREEN, we WIDEN to reveal TIME CODES and SCROLL U [NOTE: There should be 15 or 20, these are representative 07-12-23 11:29 jjj: hey daniel, see you in Berlin?  07-12-23 11:30 ddd: julian! you're coming?  07-12-23 11:30 ddd: you send in the forms for your talk? 07-12-24 12:41 ddd: julian? are you there? 07-12-26 13:56 ddd: heya, you still logged on? 07-12-27 16:41 ddd: julian? are you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Berg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL DANIEL'S SUPERVISOR, black suit and gray temples, the cubicle door. He's trying to get Daniel's attention. Daniel, OBLIVIOUS, reaches for a bottle of CLUB MATE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNOYED, the Supervisor TAPS on Daniel's headphones. Dani turns, pulls off a headphone; the electronica WHINES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds out a STACK OF PAGES, GERMAN TEXT over IMAGES OF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're printing on ... every printer in the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel looks to the printer outside his door. CHURNING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess someone's pissed you made New Year's Eve a work day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, and as our resident computer freak, could you find out who that someone is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel pulls up a DIAGNOSTIC on his computer. He scans it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever did it disguised his IP address. According to this, the print jobs are coming from... your computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The supervisor STARES. Daniel stands, starts PACKING UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's thousands of pages. You'll have to manually reboot if you want it to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off Daniel packing up) Where are you going? I need you to finish the Opel --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel hands him TWO FOLDERS from the bottom of his pile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I costed out GM too, in case you need something to do tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Supervisor stares down at the folders, Daniel grab his bike, takes off... exiting the cubicle and crossing w ANKE DOMSCHEIT (CUTE, 20S). Daniel's clearly into her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie in maintenance said you left this by the scanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds out a German edition of The Grinch Who Stole Christmas (WIE DER GRINCH). Daniel takes the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy New Year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel SMILES, pops on his headphones and wheels off. Ank not quite sure what to make of him, watches as he heads p SEVERAL CHURNING PRINTERS. Tinny electronica SWELLS and..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE RISE UP over A MAZE OF CUBICLES, little boxes, each wi a SUIT at a TIDY DESK. Daniel weaves through the maze, moving to music no one else hears, music that POUNDS US I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CRANE SHOT of the famous plaza. Industrial Eastern Bloc architecture broken up by COLORFUL MURALS and western ADS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera PANS DOWN through the gentle snowfall and we P UP A BACKPACK on a BIKE -- Daniel, HEADPHONES ON, weaving through clusters of pedestrians in the vast square.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel glides to a stop at the edge of the plaza. He hops off the bike, looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HUGE ROCKET stands outside the entrance to the HUGE CONFERENCE CENTER. A COLORFUL SIGN flaps in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 24c3: DECEMBER 27TH-31st, 2007 24TH CHAOS COMPUTER CONGRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel watches as a CROWD of GRUNGY YOUNG MEN STREAM into the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SMILE crosses his face and we CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NERDY MEN with TATS and EAR BUDS push into a hall of PULS MUSIC, FLASHING MONITORS, and JERRY-RIGGED ELECTRONICS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIND DANIEL in the throng, CAPTIVATED as he passes BOOTHS HACKERS working on various high and low tech initiatives. one, a REEDY KID with thick glasses TAKES APART an iPhone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once you crack the source code, you can reprogram it for any carrier...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...in another, a FAT HACKER powers up a QUADROCOPTER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 4K cam, varifocal zoom... it's the future of government surveillance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hacker paws a REMOTE CONTROL and the QUADROCOPTER RIS THE CAMERA FOLLOWS as it flies over booths -- Electronic Graffiti, Quantum Cryptography -- it's WILD, a stark contrast to the lifeless EDS cubicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The copter CIRCLES BACK to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel, ABSORBED, much more at home here than at EDS, gra a PAMPHLET from the quadrocopter booth and heads towards-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three guys in 24c3 shirts sign in participants, volunteer Behind them, a MAN pulls NETWORK SWITCHES from an EDS BOX Daniel walks up, hands a form to one of the volunteers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel Berg, I volunteered to sell shirts tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Daniel hands a form, the MAN at the EDS box turns. We recognize him -- it's a well-rested, almost jovial MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Daniel, thanks for getting EDS to donate again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donate may be the wrong word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus smiles, exits with the switches. A volunteer retur with a STACK OF SHIRTS. As Daniel grabs them, glancing at EASEL with the LECTURE SCHEDULE, we hear an AUSTRALIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must be on the schedule. My associate Jay Lim sent in our proposal months ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel turns, sees JULIAN ASSANGE, a strange picture with two backpacks and a TENT. Irritated, he lobbies OTTO, one the guys at the desk. Otto has an EARLOBE CORK, is UNIMPRESSED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't get anything from Wikileakers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wikileaks. This is ridiculous. Who's in charge here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian turns, doesn't recognize him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Daniel. Daniel Berg. I contacted you over chat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel. Thank God. (leans in, conspiratorial) For a moment, I thought you were...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods towards a BLUE HAIRED WEIRDO with a ton of piercings, gripping a laptop and staring at them from a nearby couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Online dating has gotten me into trouble before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MISCHIEVOUS grin. It's MAGNETIC. Daniel smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (O.C.) (out of patience) I have people waiting here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otto, his organization is super cool, they've been doing crazy shit in Kenya, they just leaked a major report on government corruption.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (skeptical, off the tent) You took on the Kenyan government from a tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it more prudent than checking into the Nairobi Hilton. (to Daniel) Of course that didn't stop Kibaki from raiding our compound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President of Kenya attacked your compound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty men, with heavy artillery... (to Otto, an edge)  Least you could do is put me on the program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid the small conference rooms are all booked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off the schedule) What about the auditorium? It's empty 'til the X-Box Security talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, then relenting) You can have it for a half hour. But you'll have to print flyers if you want an audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That shouldn't be a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian grabs his things and heads directly for a printer room... marked CLUB MEMBERS ONLY. Otto shoots Daniel a lo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God forbid we give free toner to human rights activists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a laptop hooked up to a printer... SPITTING OUT FLYERS with WIKILEAKS LOGOS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel enters. He sees the laptop sitting by a ROW OF PRINTERS, but no Julian. Until --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I totally spaced on that proposal. Of course I was a little busy in Nairobi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian gets out from UNDER A TABLE WITH a BCC EXTENSION CORD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, that report we leaked shifted voting 10% in the Presidential election. You should mention that when you introduce me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Daniel's STARING at Julian, who's pulled out a pen knife, cut the extension cord and swiftly started to FUSE with a shredded power cord. Julian notices Daniel staring

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shredded my power cord in Mombasa, I'm almost out of juice. I assume the club won't mind making a small donation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll pay for the cord if you actually get it to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian plugs the newly repaired cord into his laptop... a the screen BRIGHTENS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're going to take on global corruption, you need a few super powers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel can't help but SMILE. He picks up a flyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2007: WikiLeaks vs. The World.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a mathematician by training...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATCH CUT TO projection of the image from the flyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was a grad student in Melbourne, I began thinking about information. How it flows through people and society...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to find Julian with his laptop at a podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To one side of the stage, THE NEXT SPEAKER sets up a few deconstructed X-BOX 360s beside a CORKBOARD covered with exhibits for his talk: 'Deconstructing Xbox 360 Security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and how, when new information comes to light, it can bring about great change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel, also on stage, watches as Julian pulls out a WAD TWINE, moves to the corkboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The X-Box guy looks up, CONCERNED, as Julian wraps the tw around a PUSH PIN holding up part of the X-Box exhibit, STRINGING THE TWINE to another pin holding up another par

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian POINTS to the two pins and the twine. ILLUSTRATING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two people and a secret. The beginning of any conspiracy, of all corruption. As it grows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel watches, RIVETED, as Julian STRETCHES the twine to another pin. And another. And another...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More people... and more secrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE BOARD as Julian RAPIDLY RUNS TWINE AROUND PI ensnaring more of the exhibit in his web. It's MESMERIZIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But. If we can find one moral man, one whistleblower...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian focuses on a PIN at the CENTER of his web of twine CLOSE ON THE PIN as he LOOPS MORE TWINE AROUND IT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone willing to expose these secrets --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian PULLS THE TWINE TAUT... then YANKS THE CENTER PIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That man... can topple the most repressive of regimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian pins a WIKILEAKS FLYER on the NOW EMPTY CORKBOARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was zur hoelle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there's the problem. Retribution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otto, my talk is in ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The X-Box guy, PISSED, looks to Otto who's with a CUTE HACKER GIRL in back of the EMPTY AUDITORIUM, maybe A DOZE HACKERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we're done here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otto glares at Daniel, who would be embarrassed, if he weren't so focused on Julian. Julian keeps going, oblivio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistleblowers are afraid to come forward because they fear retribution. What if we could take that fear away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otto moves to stop Julian, but the hacker girl, INTRIGUED reaches out to STOP HIM. Otto frowns as Julian continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty years ago I got my first modem and joined a legion. Cypherpunks fighting for freedom, for privacy -- for the right to remain concealed in clouds of code.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian hits his laptop. NUMBERS and CODE appear on screen It's not the most advanced graphic you've ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today's hackers take it for granted, but they surf the net in peace thanks to the turf wars we fought. And the crypto --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SCREEN, the numbers and code fade a bit, revealing the outline of a person. Again, the graphic is AMATEUR, but i gets the point across... the person is hidden in code.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The programs we created to hide data, to hide our identities -- even then I knew this technology could be the key to a whole new form of social justice. (then) We could expose a thousand dark secrets if we could keep just one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SCREEN, the graphic morphs into the WIKILEAKS WEBSITE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundreds of volunteers work on the documents we're sent, but we've honed our technology to the point that even I don't know the identity of our sources.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian, ENERGIZED, talks like he's speaking to a huge cro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If no one knows the whistleblower's identity, he has nothing to fear. And if he has nothing to fear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian taps a laptop and WIKILEAKED DOCUMENTS appear on t screen: a MILITARY CRACKDOWN in ZAMBIA... CORRUPTION IN SOMALIA... TOP SECRET U.S. DOCUMENTS on GUANTANAMO BAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Oscar Wilde said, man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask and he will tell you the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE X-BOX GUY apologizes to a crowd at the auditorium doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, it's going to be a few minutes. We had some... technical difficulties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool talk, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel walks out of the auditorium with Otto, whose arm i around the hacker girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not cool. People anonymously sharing secrets, isn't that why we tore down the wall?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian joins with his gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, no one's interested in your secrets. (to Otto's girlfriend) Yours on the other hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She blushes, CHARMED. Otto, THREATENED, pulls her off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great talk, shame turnout wasn't better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian's still watching Otto's girl, who smiles back at h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One convert at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel laughs, pulls out his 24c3 FAHRPLAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, I can soup up those graphics if you want. From the end of the talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with the ones I have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I'm sure they would have blown people away in the eighties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, Julian considers Daniel... who holds out his FAHRPLAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to check out the talk on Microcontrollers? I hear the guy who invented TV-B-Gone is speaking. (off Julian's BLANK look) It's a remote, you walk into a bar, you can turn off all the TVs and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel reads Julian's contempt, WILTS a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I guess it's kind of stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it sounds interesting. But... don't you find it tiring? Spending time with all these wankers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel grows still. He LOVES these wankers. Or did, until just now. Julian pretending not to notice, leans in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at them. Useless idiots, cracking X-Boxes, building antennae out of Pringles cans, probably spending all their free time reading Neuromancer and playing Call of Cthulhu. What a waste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel BLANCHES. Julian's just described HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Capable generous men, men of purpose- we need to seek nobler inspiration.  (then)  Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian flashes a SEDUCTIVE SMILE then races out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Daniel follows on his heels, we SMASH TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Government buildings loom, modernist sculptures along the river. Two figures race down a street, one checks his wat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! We've only got twenty minutes! Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian rushes ahead, Daniel chasing after him as we CUT T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel, out of breath, catches up to Julian, as he approaches a HUGE GLASS GOVERNMENT BUILDING, all lit up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard goes on break at midnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian eyes his watch, slips into the building. Daniel, INTRIGUED, follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We watch through the glass as they race up the STAIRCASE, towards a BRIDGE OVERHEAD...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian and Daniel run onto the bridge. Julian, GIDDY, sli across the last few yards, coming to a stop in the middle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel pulls up beside Julian, STARING at a CRAZY VIEW of THE REICHSTAG, it's MAJESTIC GLASS DOME shining in the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A government destroyed by tyranny then rebuilt with a dome of glass so the whole world could look in. There's an ideal to aspire to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian turns, gestures the other way. THE ENTIRE CITY stretches before them, it's TOTALLY FUCKING SPECTACULAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just look at it, Daniel. Reborn from the ashes -- a city once ruled by fascists, now overrun with artists and anarchists and sunlight... transparency...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel reacts. He looks to Julian, INSPIRED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father took me to see the dome when they first built it. I was 13. He wasn't quite so eloquent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was 13, my mother started dating a guy who was part of a nasty Australian cult. The Family. They believed in blue auras and cleansing souls and had a surprisingly large network of influence, extending to the highest levels of government. My mum knew the guy was a wanker, but by the time she came to her senses they'd had a kid together and... we spent the next three years on the run. The Family chased us all over the country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Jesus. That's terrifying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you think my hair's white?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian's straight faced. Is he serious? Before we can haz a guess, an ALARM BLARES. Julian spots TWO GUARDS heading the staircase towards the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Abandon ship!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian, LAUGHING, GRABS Daniel, pulls him the other way..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cathedral-like building with a mural: 'HOW LONG IS NOW? Julian and Daniel approach the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called the Tacheles, it's an artists' squat. They were gonna tear it down in the 90s, but some painters occupied it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk through the gate and we CUT INTO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A garden of AVANT-GARDE METAL SCULPTURES and IRIDESCENT PAINTINGS. We hear techno music drifting down from above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIND a Boccioni style PORTRAIT OF A MAN staring out at us

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty great, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian stands in front of a canvas with Daniel. Daniel no

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now look closer, beyond the image, past the colors... until you've found the element that unlocks the portrait, the single brushstroke that reveals the essence of the painting, of the painter. (then) To me that's what hacking is. Finding that stroke, that code, that tiny point of entry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian looks at Daniel. Looking for his point of entry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should get to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abruptly, he heads for the building. Daniel checks the ti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian sprints up the stairs, calling out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life on the run, Aussie jet lag, you stop distinguishing between night and day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian brushes past exiting club goers, knocking a GREEN HAIRED TATTOO QUEEN into... Daniel, struggling to keep up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman gives Daniel a LOOK as he slips past her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More AVANT-GARDE ART and ECCENTRICS moving to MELLOW ELECTRONICA. Daniel finds Julian opening his laptop at on of the TABLES in the corner. Daniel sits and follows suit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... what are you working on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian lowers his laptop screen, scrutinizing Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, today was fun, but these are sensitive documents, people's lives are at stake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian eyes an ANARCHIST TATTOO, a BLACK CAT on Daniel's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was your age I called myself an anarchist too. But do you really want to change the world, Daniel? Or is that just some sticker you wear to look cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel's surprised at Julian's SUDDEN CHANGE IN TONE. It' tough, CONFRONTATIONAL, like the tone he took with Otto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I've read Orwell, Kropotkin, some Chomsky. 'The burden of proof has to be placed on authority.' You know, all animals are equal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian eyes him, impassive, not responding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Animal Farm? Maybe you've read it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel gives him a little smile. It's endearing. Julian takes it in... and makes a DECISION. Julian flicks on a CELLULAR MOBILE ROUTER and starts TYPING ON HIS LAPTOP. A CHAT BUBBLE appears on Daniel's laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON CHAT: ircs://chat.wikileaks.org/

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel, mystified, glances at Julian then clicks the link A CHAT WINDOW appears on his computer. Julian TYPES. jjj: we talk in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel, getting it, leans forward and TYPES. [NOTE: CHAT APPEARS ON OUR SCREEN, LIKE SUBTITLES]. ddd: it's secure? encrypted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: jjj: yes. and quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel SMILES. They start TYPING in QUIET CONVERSATION. jjj: there's a new leak on the submission platform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ddd: the submission platform?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel looks up at Julian. Julian smiles, mysterious... jjj: In my twenties, I created a tool called Rubberhose...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And suddenly, we SMASH INTO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A UNIVERSE OF DATA. A DOCUMENT moves at great speed throu an infinite abstraction of facts, figures, information... jjj: It hid sensitive information beneath layers and layers of fake data. Wikileaks is based on the same idea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and whenever we move close to the document, it's sudde PROTECTED, wrapped in a multi-layered SMOKESCREEN OF DATA jjj: We constantly upload fake data from fake sources to make it impossible to monitor our real sources...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the document slides down through WORMHOLES of data... jjj: Their very presence is infinitely deniable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...FLITTING AWAY from us as we catch up to it... jjj: We keep no records as to when or where you uploaded from, your time zone, your browser...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the document slips through what feels like the inside the internet, until at last we SMASH TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door opens and a document lands on a FLOOR OF SAND. jjj:   The system makes leaks untraceable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They simply turn up on the submission platform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to find THOUSANDS OF DOORS line walls of a spac receding to infinity. WELCOME TO THE SUBMISSION PLATFORM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SURREALISTIC VISION, Julian's romantic view of journali ROWS of STEEL DESKS set in sand, a different COMPUTER on each, FLUORESCENTS hanging oddly above. Behind the doors, hear the SOUND OF AN OCEAN. In front, find...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian with Daniel, at their Tacheles table. Daniel, taki it all in, spots a few OCCUPIED DESKS. Glowing monitors obscure faces, but we see NAME PLATES. J LIM. T BELLMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, then Julian nudges Daniel. A STACK OF DOCUMENTS s in front of one of the doors. Daniel looks at them, maybe noticing a JULIUS BAER LOGO on the front page. He TYPES. ddd: who's it from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian smiles at Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See the beauty of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods to his laptop, a doc with THE SAME JULIUS BAER LO jjj: ever hear of Julius Baer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ddd: it's a big Swiss Bank, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now, we SMASH TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grand neoclassical facade of BANK JULIUS BAER. jjj: huge. manages $100 billion for the ultra rich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PUSH past the large logo, through a window into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rich, traditionally decorated LOBBY of BANK JULIUS BA BANKERS in wealthy suits greet obscenely wealthy CLIENTEL jjj: wealthy assholes in Germany, Switzerland, UK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POV SHOT walks us out of the lobby and into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HALLWAY OF WOOD CUBICLES, THICK DOORS. The bankers pass us, leading their clients down the hall. ddd: the leak is from someone inside the bank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: jjj: think so, my associate Jay Lim is working the docs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POV SHOT FOLLOWS the bankers and their clients into..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POSH CORNER OFFICE. We see a stack of DOCUMENTS on a TA beside a WHITE BOARD with a SHELL COMPANY DIAGRAM. jjj: we think they show how the bank uses offshore secrecy laws to hide $$ for fat cats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN AROUND THE TABLE TO FIND Daniel and Julian sitting there, looking from the documents to the WHITE BOARD DIAGRAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guten tag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian and Daniel stare at the WHITE BOARD DIAGRAM, now o Julian's laptop. A WAITRESS with a NOSE RING smiles at th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian SLAMS SHUT his laptop, paranoid, HOSTILE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smile fading, bored) Let me guess. Secret plans for the revolution?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian walks out of the cathedral-like building, TAPPING his computer, a MEMORY STICK in the USB slot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's tax evasion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL Daniel following behind, carrying all the bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a grand scale. How secure is your computer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GELI full disk encryption with two factor authentication.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Unlike most reporters, we verify our sources. Jay and our volunteers in Switzerland will analyze the docs, but I need you to confirm they're real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian pulls out the MEMORY STICK, holds it out to Daniel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meta data should list the authors. Extract it and verify these people work at the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian's warm, but Daniel STARES at the memory stick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Did you think we just threw what we got up on the website?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but.. you're just giving me the docs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said I could trust you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mans up, takes the stick) You can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I'm a good judge of character.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian flashes a smile then grabs his things, heads off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay off the internet when working on the docs. And buy yourself a cryptophone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A familiar hallway. A phone RINGS, breaking the silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIND a FORMIDABLE ASSISTANT in a cubicle outside the posh corner office. She picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius Baer, Ralf Zilke's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Daniel, cryptophone to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I must have the wrong extension. What division is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Personal Wealth Management. Who were you looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL Daniel in small closet filled with cleaning SUPPLI He sits on an overturned MOP BUCKET, a document on his la

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I was actually looking for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel eyes TWO LAPTOPS crammed on a shelf. On one, the WHITE BOARD DIAGRAM. On the other, a window of META DATA with A TIME STAMP and a LIST OF AUTHORS, Ralf Zilke and..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Leisal Grop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Grop is down the hall in Client Services. Can I transfer you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, please. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel waits a beat... then HANGS UP THE PHONE. He pulls a pencil, looks down at the document on his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a marked up LIST OF NAMES. Daniel CHECKS OFF Zil and Grop, begins writing down their divisions when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STORE ROOM DOOR OPENS BEHIND HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel? What are you doing in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel turns. Anke is in the door. Just then, one of his computers BEEPS. A chat pops up. TBellman: Daniel, I'm Thomas Bellman, WL's Swiss spokesman. Julian said you're working on the bank docs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel, what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel looks from the computer to Anke, AWKWARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm doing some.. sensitive research.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The laptop BEEPS again. Daniel, UNCOMFORTABLE, turns to i TBellman: Daniel? Have you confirmed authorship of the docs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anke is CURIOUS. Daniel TYPES, tries to block her view. ddd: The authors are all bank employees... THE DOCS ARE REAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he finishes, a FLURRY OF CHAT pops up on screen -- JayLim: Hey, is Julian plugged in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: jjj: Hoi. Just landed. What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JayLim: Our source agreed to explain the docs, can anyone get to Liege-Guillemins in Belgium by 4pm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TBellman: Daniel's in Germany, that's not too far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JayLim: Is he up for it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: jjj: I think so... if he's not too busy sucking off THE CORPORATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brightly lit monitors obscure faces but the nameplates ar now familiar. J LIM, T BELLMAN, J ASSANGE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian PEEKS OUT from behind his monitor, smiles at Danie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this some kind of geeky, hacker version of Dungeons and Dragons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel turns, sees Anke LOOKING OVER HIS SHOULDER. He quickly shuts his laptop. Then, TRYING TO IMPRESS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're investigating corruption in a large swiss bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anke BLINKS, intrigued... a political side to Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, in that case, I can cover for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Daniel, a HINT OF A SMILE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Calatrava marvel. It's EERILY EMPTY... as we FIND DAN walking up the platform, texting on his phone.

dialogues.speaker: THE TEXTS
dialogues.text: Daniel Berg: at the train station, where's our guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat then... Thomas Bellman: Le Chat Noir. Heavyset, brown suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel starts walking inside. His phone BUZZES, He checks it. Thomas Bellman: WATCH YOUR BACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel pauses, looks over his shoulder. A few travelers, nothing out of the ordinary... until from HIS POV WE SEE HARD LOOKING BALD MAN leaning against a wall, STARING at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he WATCHING Daniel? Or is it in Daniel's head? Daniel, NERVOUS, pulls up his coat, hurries onward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a thick hand, SHAKING, nervously paging through document with more diagrams like the one we saw above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in whispers) Our team has been having trouble... the diagrams are a bit impenetrable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL HANS, 40s, SWEATING in the rail station cafe. He a Daniel sit at a table. Talking in HUSHED TONES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're meant to be. They reveal the bank's most intimate secrets. (passionate, intense)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I worked for these assholes for years before I understood the extent of the deception. It's a massive tax dodge.... last year, those diagrams cheated your country alone out of 30 billion in tax revenues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you'll explain them to us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous) You understand I won't just be exposing the bank. They have hundreds of clients -- wealthy, powerful clients from New York to Moscow who will go to great lengths to hold on to their money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, Daniel spots a BALD MAN at the bar. Shit, it's the guy from the platform. Daniel TENSES, tries to cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We understand the risks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Hans follows Daniel's gaze to the bald man... watchin them. Hans looks NERVOUS. Daniel struggles to project cal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got incredible infrastructure and hundreds of volunteers, people who've dealt with threats like this. Our process is totally secure -- we don't even know your real name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're damn right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN joins the man at the bar.    Hans, anxiety dropping...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll explain the documents, but you don't know me, you never met me and when the shit comes down, it's on your house. Are we clear, Mr...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel eyes a SIGN on the wall. A black cat, 'LE CHAT NOI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schmitt. Daniel Schmitt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Daniel's ADRENALINE RUSH, we hear a SHRILL WHISTLE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The station's arch glows above Daniel in the dark night. Daniel, WIRED, glances furtively at other travelers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bank has a huge network, they've got billions of dollars buried in the Caymans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smog filled street. ANCIENT MINIVANS, THRONGS of PEOPLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nairobi, Kenya

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PUSH IN on a DILAPIDATED BUILDING and PRELAP --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is absolutely colossal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shabby OFFICE, a few HUMAN RIGHTS POSTERS. Julian helps two Kenyan human rights activists (OULA and KINGARA) hand out PICKET SIGNS to VOLUNTEERS. He talks on a cryptophone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna nail these bastards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel warily looks at the passersby. No sign of the bald man from inside, but Daniel's still ON EDGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, our friend was pretty jittery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course he was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Daniel, cold comfort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Julian, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oula, SCAR on his cheek, beckons to Julian -- they're heading out. Julian looks at his sign: 'ANOTHER WORLD IS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How fast can you get Bellman a summary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll stay up until it's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Remember, Daniel, courage is contagious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel reacts as a train WHISTLES again, the sound fading into a PIERCING TELEPHONE RING --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a RINGING PHONE. A hand reaches in and we REVEAL the assistant we met earlier, as she picks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius Baer Bank, Ralf Zilke's office

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she listens, her expression changes and we CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SILVER-HAIRED BANKER (ZILKE) works in a posh corner office, noblesse oblige in a BRIONI SUIT. He reaches for pen when--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Zilke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zilke looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I just got an odd call from the tech department. They said there's a report on this website... it's posted some of our files. I sent you the link.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zilke eyes her, then turns to his COMPUTER. He clicks an mail link and up pops THE WIKILEAKS SITE with a DOCUMENT:

dialogues.speaker: CLOUDS ON THE CAYMAN TAX HEAVEN
dialogues.text: DOCUMENTS: How the Swiss Bank hides Millions for your favorite fat cats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below, a FAMILIAR DIAGRAM. ZILKE SEES IT AND GOES WHITE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me Gregor. And wake up our lawyers in London, in New York, in California...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel back on his mop bucket, staring at two laptops on shelf. On one, a THREATENING E-MAIL from Julius Baer lawyers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I thought grinching the printers was impressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel turns and finds Anke standing over him with a prin out of the Julius Baer doc. She eyes his computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their lawyers are threatening you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian says you can spend your life in cushy cubicles or you can march. You can brave the truncheons and breathe the tear gas or --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a girl to dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An INVITATION. Daniel smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on Anke, asleep, NAKED under a cheap coverlet. We h TAPPING on a keyboard. Anke stirs, blinks up at the CHAOS COMPUTER CLUB POSTERS over the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anke smiles, turns to see... Daniel at a messy desk, tapp on his laptop and pulling on his jeans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel, distracted, TRIPS and FALLS. Anke LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I've just never had a guy try to sneak out of his own apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bank got a judge in California to shut down our primary domain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods to his LAPTOP. A WEB BROWSER points to wikileaks. but the site is down: THE REQUESTED PAGE IS UNAVAILABLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A judge in California?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's where our domain is registered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, but I thought Americans put free speech up there with mom and apple pie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So did we. Julian wants to meet up right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel throws his laptop in his backpack then pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know this isn't what I imagined for our first... get together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How often did you imagine it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel smiles, CAUGHT. He grabs his bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have a cryptophone do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but that may be the best excuse I've ever heard for not calling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They trade a SMILE and we SMASH TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian glides down a people mover, TAPPING his phone. As does, e-mail SCROLLS UP THE SCREEN: Friends - Solzhenitsyn says no one can bar the road to truth. Wikileaks.org has been forcibly shut down but you can still learn the truth about Julius Baer on our mirror sites. Send press to http://wikileaks.be, http://88.80.13.160 --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Julian glides along, typing, we SMASH TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel rides the tram talking on his cryptophone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...blogs, twitter, they're defrauding the world, we can't let them cover it up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the tram lurches forward, we see TWITTER FEED start to scroll up the LEFT of the screen... EthanZ Walk the road to truth! http://wikileaks.be Mlsif Break the bank! Send press to 88.80.13.160

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The twitter feed CONTINUES TO SCROLL and we SMASH TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian walks into an all night cafe, hauling his bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We never thought we'd need extra servers to fight censorship attacks--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian walks into the dingy cafe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...from the bastion of free speech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian sees TWO OPEN LAPTOPS, a few empty bottles of Club Mate... and DANIEL, on the phone. Daniel doesn't see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I sent links to our mirror sites, if you can post...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel spots Julian, lowers his phone. WARM --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More fun making history than reading about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel smiles. A NICE MOMENT... until Daniel's laptop BEE A news alert, WIRED.COM: ACLU, EFF, HEARST FILE BRIEFS IN SUPPORT OF WIKILEAKS CASE. They spring back into action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Yeah, and there's a new Wired blog you should post as well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian pulls out his laptop as TWITTER FEED TAKES US TO -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dawn breaks over Berlin. We hear Julian --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (PRELAP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course, we're pleased the EFF and the ACLU are behind us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun rises over EMPTY BOTTLES, COFFEE CUPS... Daniel a Julian each have two laptops, still going strong. Julian talks on the phone, eats hummus with his finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (INTO THE PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but the court of public opinion has already ruled in our favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel's computer BEEPS again as SITE NOTIFICATIONS start SCROLL UP the RIGHT OF OUR SCREEN, opposite twitter feed. www.largeleaker.de is now pointing to 88.80.13.160 www.screwthebank.com is now pointing to 88.80.13.160

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some french hackers donated domains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel shows Julian his laptop. Julian lowers his phone, wipes his hummus finger on his pants. Daniel notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send the links to Bellman, he'll blast the list serve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel reaches forward to type and we SMASH TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half the monitors are lit, DOZENS OF VOLUNTEERS working away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel opens a CHAT BOX and we RACK FOCUS TO A DESK. We n the nameplate, T BELLMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We CUT BEHIND THE DESK --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel's CHAT pops up on Bellman's MONITOR. As he reaches forward, TWITTER FEED and URLs SCROLL UP our SCREEN. And it's OVERWHELMING, that's what we're going for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALAN RUSBRIDGER and IAN KATZ (from the OPEN) review a row one sheets tacked to the wall -- TOMORROW'S PAPER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move the US primaries to page three to make room for the Diana inquest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Diana still sells papers. 21st century churnalism at its finest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rusbridger and Katz turn to find NICK DAVIES (also from t OPEN), all looks and charm in an out of date leather jack

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't afford reporters? Grab a story off the wire, give it a little scrub and drop it in your paper. (mock smells the print) Just the kind of quality journalism I left Oxford to pursue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This how you're chatting up the totty in your golden years?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I certainly can't impress them with stories that've been rattling round the mainstream media echo chamber. The women I meet are smart enough to know what they're missing out on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I assume you're going to tell us what that is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll leave that to Mr. Assange and his merry band of programmers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands them a printout of another tech blog from WIRED. Alan glances at the headline: 'WIKILEAKS VS. GOLIATH.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Alan reads, a GOOGLE NEWS SEARCH scrolls over him, UP SCREEN, REPLACING THE TWITTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VIBRANT TURKISH CAFE in an polyglot neighborhood... odd set against a backdrop of blocky West German architecture

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our GOOGLE SEARCH scrolls up the screen and we MATCH CUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LAPTOP with the Google News Search. Wikileaks is still live, and kicking THE GUARDIAN - 6 hours ago

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge Shuts Down Site, Raises Constitutional Issues NEW YORK TIMES - 3 hours ago

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freedom of Speech has a number - 88.80.13.160 CBS NEWS - 30 minutes ago

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mouse CLICKS on the CBS story, which OPENS in a window. next to OPEN STORIES from the Times and the Guardian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guardian, The Times, CBS... are all linking to our mirror sites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL Daniel with Julian in a mostly EMPTY cafe, surroun by coffee cups and NEWSPAPERS with JULIUS BAER HEADLINES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading the article) The Bank's injunction has brought an obscure group of dreamers to prominence, paradoxically generating more attention for their apparently uncensorable leaking machine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel and Julian are HAGGARD, it's plain they haven't sl in days, but they're both FLYING. Daniel scans the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the bank's clients may now face prosecution in Germany, the US... (thrilled) Jesus, can you believe it? Actual justice for those assholes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then Julian's laptop BEEPS. He reads, STUNNED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. The judge pulled the injunction. We're back online.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls up wikileaks.org on his laptop. Daniel is FLOORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit. We won!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian is proud, but Daniel's OVER THE MOON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We took down a billion dollar bank! This is crazy, we have to celebrate!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...sure, we should order some beers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean with everyone. Bellman and Jay Lim and all the others. This was a team effort, we should get everyone up on Skype or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. It's... late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just got an e-mail from Bellman. And Jay was on chat 15 minutes ago.. (then) What? You think Skype isn't secure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian hesitates. Considering SOMETHING. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... it's probably time for you to meet everyone face to face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel smiles, pulls up Bellman's account and Jay's. Juli watches, PENSIVE... as Daniel INITIATES the VIDEO CALLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the SKYPE RING on Daniel's computer and INTERCUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ten desk rows deep, CAMERA behind a dozen volunteer Daniel and Julian at the cafe table in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few monitors LIGHT UP WITH SKYPE CALLS. As volunteers l forward to answer, WE HEAR an ANSWER CHIRP and Daniel's f pops up in a couple of screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANIEL IN THE CAFE, staring at his laptop. CONFUSED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it, it says I called...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel looks at Julian, something DAWNING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SUBMISSION PLATFORM DESK. Nameplate: T BELLMAN. DOLLY AROUND the monitor on the desk... REVEALING JULIAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nameplate: J LIM. DOLLY AROUND this monitor... Julian aga He looks up, coy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANIEL IN THE CAFE. TWO SKYPE BOXES OF JULIAN on his scre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Jay and Bellman? (unnerved) How many volunteers do we have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundreds.

dialogues.speaker: DOLLY AROUND A SERIES OF DESKS/COMPUTERS IN RAPID
dialogues.text: SUCCESSION. Each time, we find Julian at the computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEN WE PULL BACK TO THE FRONT OF THE ROOM... an infinite number of Julians peek out from the infinite monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have hundreds of volunteers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel's pale. He stares at Julian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I have hundreds of e-mail addresses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the same th--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian puts a finger to his lips, WARILY eyes a waiter. H grabs his pack, moves to the back. Daniel follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every startup exaggerates its size. No one's going to leak sensitive material to two freaks with a single server.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We only have one server?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not as far as the rest of the world is concerned. (then) Castro began a revolution with 82 men. It doesn't matter how small you are if you have faith and a plan of action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Daniel is STUNNED...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told dozens of reporters... our source at Julius Baer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Necessary fictions. If Julius Baer knew they were up against an army of two...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, they'd 'rub us out?' They're a bank, not the mob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why have you been using an alias? (pressing) Come on, Daniel. It's just a hack, an inelegant solution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a hundred friends I could call, people who would be happy to help. This is bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel turns away, pissed. A beat. Then Julian GRABS his backpack and RIPS IT OPEN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
