dialogues.text: ANGRILY, VIOLENTLY pulling out LAPTOPS, POWERCORDS, CLOTHING; SINGLE SERVINGS of CANNED FRUIT, GLASS JARS of STICKS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...where is it, where the hell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel turns, stunned, as Julian pulls out WIRELESS ROUTE SOCKS, SHOES, NOTEBOOKS... until at last he finds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SMALL PIECE OF PAPER. Newsprint. Folded and soft with a He THRUSTS it at Daniel. Daniel blinks, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel hesitates, then unfolds it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON an old newspaper article.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May 1995. LEAD 'SUBVERSIVE' TO STAND TRIAL FOR 31 COUNTS HACKING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beside the headline, a MUG SHOT of a younger Julian -- a long ponytail and a defiant expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were three of us. Mendax, Trax, Prime Suspect, three boys with cartoon names, off on a series of harmless adventures, 'Subversives' one and all.  But when the Federal Police finally caught up with us, Trax pled guilty and Prime Suspect -- he turned Crown Witness against me.  (beat)  I remember waiting for the verdict in this little room, walking in figure eights like some demented bee, imagining life in a tiny cell. The stress, that was... actually the moment my hair turned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel takes this in.   A beat, then internal, wounded --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't get far in this world by relying on others. People are loyal until it seems opportune not to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now Julian reaches out. Vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tyrants we're up against have money and men and guns and I don't have an army to fight them. All I've got is a website and a couple of fake e-mail addresses and... you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Daniel, YIELDING, we HEAR a recording --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only way you can control people is to lie to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUN sets over the GORGEOUS BUILDINGS of OLD ANTWERP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HUGE BANNER stretches across the CONVENTION CENTER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A table COVERED with WIKILEAKS NEWS CLIPS. Some are old ( investigates Julius Baer') but many are new. US MILITARY MANUALS, a PROTEST RIOT IN TIBET... the clips mostly in small, alternative papers. Julian and Daniel have been BU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only way you can control anybody is to lie to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He founded the damn religion. Gobsmacking isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIND Julian and Daniel streaming video of Hubbard for a f reporters, their HUMBLE BOOTH dwarfed in a vast room fill with MORE IMPRESSIVE DISPLAYS of old and new media ventur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off the Hubbard video) This is on your site?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're streaming it now. See, there are links to all our fresh leaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel shows him another laptop. The site is rudimentary, column of analysis and a column of FRESH LEAKS including.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People need to see how they treat their members. The memos on their 'introspection rundowns' -- forced isolation, regulation of meals...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six Apart would love a piece on this, you have a French spokesman I can follow up with in Paris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like watching a young Woodward and Bernstein...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick Davies and Ian Katz walk up in GUARDIAN PRESS PASSES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hallowed Guardian gracing us with their presence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian starts to move towards them but the French reporte pad out, is in his way. Brusquely pushing past --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reporter is offended. Daniel, used to this, jumps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our associate Jay Lim is based in Paris. Can I give you his e-mail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN OFF the mollified reporter to Nick shaking Julian's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hustling for a story, trying to get the world to pay attention, I almost wish I were working for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way they're sacking journalists, you might not have a choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like you want to put us all out of business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to do your job. If you can't, someone needs to pick up the slack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you're doing? Anyone can take a bundle of information, toss it up on a website and call it news. But people buy our papers for something a little more discerning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're still buying your papers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, we're all on the same team. (to Ian) It's the samizdat of our day, Ian, a new nervous system for the planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ian considers the Scientology video... which FREEZES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like his nervous system's a bit twitchy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10,000 hits an hour does that to you. How's your website doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick LAUGHS. But as he and Ian exit, Julian's smile FADES Daniel joins him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're down again. We need to add servers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, that's the downside to selling truth for free. No money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (considers, then) ...I've got a few thousand euros saved up. Bet that'd get us a half dozen machines on eBay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian reacts, a little surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we not inspired, men of purpose? Capable, generous men?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian SMILES BROADLY and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel's cubicle. A mess as before. Exactly as before. Daniel's supervisor stands at the door. IRRITATED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were coming back today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL Anke, on her phone, a few cubicles away. CONCERNED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel, on the phone, stands by a RENTAL MERCEDES STATION WAGON, filling out a form. Julian is in the car, door ope

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little detour. Why, do you miss me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At EDS, Anke eyes Daniel's Supervisor, who walks towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but our friend Andreas seems to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andreas is a wanker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and my sister was looking forward to meeting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. I forgot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll understand, she's an understanding person. Fortunately for you, so am I. But Andreas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him I'm still sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (for Andreas' benefit) Pneumonia? Is it serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very. See if your sister's free for dinner on Friday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By Friday, I'll want you to myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel smiles, hangs up and hands the form to a RENTAL AGENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you say you were going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian GLARES at the agent. Daniel gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel slips behind the wheel and starts the car. Julian stares at the rental agent and starts to SUCK ON A RAW LEMON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nosy prick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was being friendly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Servers are vital organs, if people know where they are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's going to know where they are, he was just being friendly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, he was acting weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel stares at Julian's lemon. He was acting weird?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I need some vitamin C. Have you seen how pale I am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ODD BEAT... then Julian SMILES. He's joking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're looking a bit pale yourself, young man. Maybe you should have one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian playfully tosses a lemon at Daniel who SMILES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still smiling, Daniel drives out of town. He casually che the REARVIEW... as a BLACK BMW falls in and begins to fol close behind. Julian sees Daniel's smile FADE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably nothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Julian sees him peering into the rearview. FREAKED --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's following us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian looks back just as Daniel makes a HARD RIGHT, POPP THE CAR up on the curb. Julian SLAMS against the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel struggles with the wheel, barely managing to get t car back on the road. He glances again at the rearview...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you lose him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.. no, shit, I think that's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Daniel guns the engine, Julian FLIES OUT OF FRAME...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm going to vomit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music takes us through a SERIES OF QUICK SCENES --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel rushes out of his apartment, carries a server to t Mercedes and tosses it in the trunk beside six others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian, waiting, hastily throws a TARP over them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Julian and Daniel jump into the car and take off, we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mercedes FLIES towards the SKYSCRAPERS of LA DEFENSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian and Daniel crouch behind the car, holding a SERVER The data center door cracks and A SKINNY FRENCH HACKER beckons ANXIOUSLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they RUSH towards him, SMASH TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian works on his laptop, struggling to stay awake. He considers, then reaches for a Club Mate and takes a sip..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's disgusting. Julian looks at Daniel, CHUGGING IT. Wid awake. As Julian FORCES HIMSELF to take another sip...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car races twards the twin spires of the GROSSMUNSTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old town. Daniel, Julian with a server, banging on a DOOR nervously looking around. The door cracks, they rush in..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIUS BAER SWISS HQ. The Mercedes rolls into frame. Dani and Julian hop out, shouting and GIVING THE BANK THE FING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw you, assholes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suck my tax paying German weiner!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They JUMP AROUND, CELEBRATORY, as we SMASH TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel clings to the wheel, EXHAUSTED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you pass me a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel looks over... Julian's WIRED, typing on his laptop polishing off the last Club Mate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music fades as we PRELAP --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't look like a data center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WORKING FARM. Julian eyes the sleeping cows. Daniel ope the trunk of the Mercedes, pulls out a case of Club Mate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the way to my heart Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel turns, sees Marcus in the farmhouse door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LARGE BARN, PACKED with SERVERS. TECH HEAVEN. Marcus wa in, leading Julian and Daniel who carry a server. Julian looks around, blown away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off the server) Hook that up next to the other old IBMs. And take any tags off it -- I don't want to know which one it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They set the server down. Daniel starts hooking it up as Marcus cracks open a Club Mate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're protecting us from yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plausible deniability is never a bad thing. Especially when there might be jackboots at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed) A man who understands security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just following in the tradition of some excellent hackers. One in particular who went by this curious name, something out of Horace... in parentum splendide Mendax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Julian's hacker name. He looks up, GUARDED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way Daniel talks, I suspected an illustrious past. So I did some digging. Hacking Nasa? Impressive. And Milnet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hacked the US Defense Network?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel's intrigued. Julian LAUGHS, guard dropping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a long time ago. There were dozens of back doors, it wasn't all that difficult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delightfully deceiving, like his name. And your 'robust' infrastructure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Julian, whose smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any leet hack could see your tech was junk. Good thing you're adding servers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dismissive, looks out the window) Mmm. So the cows... do you milk them yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TRUNK OPENS on a CASE of EMPTY BOTTLES. Daniel grabs th Julian sits on the car hood, working on his laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can do some coding, but I don't want him on the primary server.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus just wants to get involved. He's a bit of a legend in the club. He could be a big help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People with that much experience tend to have minds of their own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON DANIEL. Something about that bothers him. But before h can comment --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy Shit.  (staring at his laptop)  The Scientology video is generating a ton of new traffic... we've got half a dozen new leaks. A nuclear cover up in Iran, a list of British National Party members.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel, intrigued, looks over Julian's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, it's thousands of neo-nazis, right in the heart of London...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2100 kilometers? Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn. The rental guy STARES at the ODOMETER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind your own business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of your goddamn business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE HEAR the sound of A DOOR SWINGING OPEN and we SMASH TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STACK of DOCUMENTS as it drops just beyond an OPEN DOOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door closes and we REVEAL the long LINE OF DOORS. A f open, STACKS OF DOCUMENTS tossed into the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see NUCLEAR SYMBOLS on an IRANIAN REPORT; a GERMAN SEC SERVICE document labeled TOP SECRET; FINANCIAL DOCUMENTS from the KAUPTHING BANK in Iceland... it's MESMERIZING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we watch we notice a familiar WHINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FAINT ELECTRONICA pulls us through the sea of empty desks to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LONE OCCUPIED DESK. Docs, Club Mate bottles and a NAMEPLATE: D SCHMITT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOLLY AROUND to find Daniel in headphones, hunched over a laptop. He POUNDS away to thumping music. PLUGGED IN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel keeps typing as we SMASH TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel, headphones on, plugged in, hunched over a laptop. eyeing a list, members of the BRITISH NATIONALIST PARTY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL DANIEL'S SUPERVISOR in the door, peering past Dani at the WIKILEAKS ICON on his screen. PISSED. Daniel turns HOLDS his gaze then TURNS BACK TO HIS LAPTOP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Daniel, who finishes what he was doing then clos his laptop. As he tosses it in his backpack we PULL OUT a see HIS DESK IS EMPTY, his things packed up in a few BOXE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anke walks in, grabs a box. Daniel grabs the other, exits past his supervisor, who shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel walks in, drops the box on his desk and sits back down to work. As he types, the CAMERA SPINS.... EMPTY CLU MATE BOTTLES and TAKE-OUT CONTAINERS piling up as time passes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At last, Daniel pauses, picking up a copy of THE GUARDIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel keeps reading. We see the paper over his shoulder: BNP MEMBERSHIP LIST NAMES POLICE OFFICERS AND OFFICIALS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Daniel hears her. He rubs his eyes and we're in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same computer, now in Daniel's bedroom. A WIKILEAKS WAR ZONE. Documents, newspapers, bottles everywhere. Daniel surveys the carnage then stands, carrying THE GUARDIAN in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE LIVING ROOM. A table set for a ROMANTIC DINNER, a VOT burning low, Anke passing time on a laptop with OPEN DATA STICKERS (EFF, FSF, CC). Daniel walks in, kisses her chee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And starving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Anke the paper then picks up a knife, starts to carve the roast on the table. He serves Anke...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The British press is going nuts over the National Party member list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anke looks less than enthusiastic, but Daniel doesn't notice. He makes himself a plate and sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are donating money. Not a lot, but some. And we keep getting more leaks. Toxic dumping in Ivory Coast, corruption in Kosovo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel takes a bite, pauses, trying not to make a face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You don't like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's delicious. Just a little cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it's been sitting there for an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ah) Sorry. I didn't hear you. (then) You could have gotten me. Anke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just the addresses I don't get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The National Party members. I mean, those people should be exposed, but you published their personal information. Phone numbers, home addresses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were in the document.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but why not cut them out? Those people have families, children... someone could get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Editing reflects bias. Our sources, people on the site, they trust us cause we don't screw with the docs. As Julian says, a free people must have knowledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or as Orwell says, Big Brother is watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Is this cause I stayed in on Friday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't care less about Friday, I had a perfectly good time with Nik and Claudia, despite the fact that Nik tried to get me to go home with him again. (off Daniel's look) Don't look so concerned, he bores the shit out of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe that's what you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (don't do that) I'm the one who told you to quit your job. And I'm glad you did. I'm just saying that if you're gonna nail yourself to a cross you should probably know what it's made of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not nailing myself to a cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anke raises an eyebrow. Daniel looks down, notes his own disheveled appearance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I guess I could use a shower. Care to join me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel smiles, suggestive. Anke softens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you even remember the last time we had sex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure I'll remember the next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her. A hint of Julian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So goddamn clever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a little clever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves in, PULLS A STRING at her back. Her dress SLIPS the floor. She smiles, despite herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FLOOR.  A CHAIR FALLS as Daniel pulls Anke down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can go into the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sexy. Things start to get even sexier when... Anke FREEZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel looks at her confused when... THUMP. Daniel FREEZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that the door?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUMP THUMP. Shit. WHO THE FUCK IS THAT?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't expecting anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel TOTALLY FREAKED, reaches up, KILLS THE LIGHTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neo-nazis wouldn't knock, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anke, NERVOUS, grabs her dress as Daniel picks up a heavy WIRE CUTTER.   SHAKING, he peers past the Tibetan flag he uses as a blind... and then RELAXES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anke confused, watches him open the door... JULIAN blows

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weren't you in Australia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it best not to telegraph my movements. By the way, you should take your name off the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian sits at the table, not bothering to acknowledge An as she pulls her dress on. Daniel glances at Anke, TORN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was the last time you were online?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian pulls out his laptop, pushes the roast out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a new expose from the Kenyan National Coalition on Human Rights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian shows Daniel the computer. Daniel can't help himse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've got evidence that Kenyan police are running death squads?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friends of mine wrote the report, Kibaki is trying to bury it, we've got to get it up on the homepage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel hesitates. Now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It details hundreds of murders, major human rights violations-- it's like exposing Chile under Pinochet. (he starts typing, then) You have any of that disgusting energy drink? Could be a long night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel heads into the kitchen. Julian notices Anke, still wrestling with her dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, did I interrupt something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's both CAVALIER and LEWD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anke REACTS and we CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel walking in with two Club Mates. The front door SLA Anke. Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel runs out of his apartment, chasing after Anke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anke. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He catches up to her, reaches for her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were having sex! I was half naked!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel looks down. She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you invite him to Paris, too? Because he's really not my type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't invite him. Anke, please. Come back inside. It's late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then tell him to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him. Simple. Direct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to come back inside, tell him to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... Anke, he's got nowhere else to stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel walks in, numb. He stands there for a moment, then notices Julian... WEARING A SUIT JACKET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that my suit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working on a press release on the Kenyan death squads, I needed something to match the gravity of the occasion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian reaches for the roast, PICKING at it WITH HIS FINGERS. Daniel blinks. This is who he's following into t abyss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upset, Daniel grabs the roast and walks it into the kitch Agitated, he starts to wrap up the roast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a son in Melbourne, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel turns. Julian stands in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns 19 next week, I haven't seen him in a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian pulls out his wallet, shows Daniel a picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes two things to change the world. You'd be surprised how many people have ideas. But commitment, true commitment, that's the hard one. It requires sacrifice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel, stirred, stares at the photo of Julian's son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel. His name is Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Daniel, reacting --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An anchor. Gray haired and GRAVE [in Icelandic, subtitles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We lead tonight with the collapse of the Kaupthing bank. Due to a court injunction, we can't bring you the whole story. But there is an organization that can. You'll find them at Wikileaks.org.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the WIKILEAKS URL flashes on screen we CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON HOST EGILL HELGASON, on his Icelandic TV News sh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iceland was bankrupted by the Kaupthing, but we wouldn't know it if not for my guests tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helgason turns to Daniel and Julian, beside him. We notic that Daniel has STARTED GROWING A BEARD...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've done so much for our country, how can we show our thanks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Protect free speech. Strengthen your laws, give activists in countries without freedom of the press a home. We have too many offshore tax havens, we need more offshore media havens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helgason starts CLAPPING. He's joined by more applause an we PULL BACK to REVEAL the ENTIRE CREW CLAPPING WITH HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about it, Iceland?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Daniel, THRILLED, the APPLAUSE SMASHES US TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ICELANDIC TV CREW (RUV) interviews BIRGITTA JONSDOTTIR front of the imposing Parliament Building. A CROWD watche

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wikileaks is redefining the public's right to information, I'd like to add whatever legitimacy I can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd CHEERS as we FIND TWO IDENTICAL BACKPACKS in th midst. Julian and Daniel watch as Birgitta wraps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a Member of Parliament?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And apparently our new spokesperson. Some animals are more equal than others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian smiles at Daniel as the music SMASHES US TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Birgitta stands at a bar with Daniel and a small crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Making Iceland a media haven, it's an inspired idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel smiles, sees Julian dancing with THREE HOT WOMEN under a CHEAP DISCO BALL. Julian spreads his arms, calls him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need space for your ego to flow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel smiles and starts dancing like Julian. Daniel's ON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MUSIC SWELLS as we SMASH TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAPERS WITH WIKI-HEADLINES dropped one by one on a desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Iceland bank. The Natanz cover up. Corruption in Kosovo, in Kenya--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL Nick dropping the small, foreign paper clippings o Alan's desk. Alan and Ian Katz eye the papers skeptically

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great big scoops in tiny, local papers, stories that could have been picked up by the mainstream press. It's an opportunity, Alan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Nick, wry, the music SMASHES US TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Third world gridlock, beat up cars inching their way thro squalid, downtown Nairobi. Beggars and vendors swarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..earlier this week Wikileaks posted a human rights report detailing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a BEAT UP STATION WAGON and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIND Oula and Kingara, the activists we saw with Julian earlier. They're in traffic, FAMILIAR PICKET SIGNS in bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...shocking police misconduct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Student Union wants to hold a protest at the University next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oula, behind the wheel, is frustrated by the traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might take that long to get there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oula shoots a wry look at Kingara, who cracks a SMILE... ...but as he does, WE HEAR A POP. Oula STARTS, then stare as BLOOD SPREADS ACROSS KINGARA'S WHITE BUTTON-DOWN SHIRT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oula reacts, TERRIFIED.   FRANTIC, he reaches for the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG BANG BANG BANG BANG! The car is RIDDLED WITH BULLETS Oula FLAILS then SLUMPS across the wheel. The horn BLARES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and we see BLOOD oozing over a folder on Kingara's lap over a SYMBOL for THE KENYAN COMMISSION ON HUMAN RIGHTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horn's wail SILENCES the music and we FADE TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AERIAL SHOT: a CAMPGROUND overtaken by an ODD HACKER CIRC -- NEON WIRES snaking among dozens of HUGE, ILLUMINATED TENTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE FOCUS IN on a BIG TENT with a HUGE WIKILEAKS FLAG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've exposed death squads in Kenya, an Iranian nuclear cover up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MOB of REVELERS drink beer and smoke pot under BIG MONITORS displaying the WIKILEAKS SITE. Large tables hold PILES of Wikileaks NEWS CLIPPINGS and the latest leaked docs/photos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...in Iceland, the government has taken over the Kaupthing bank...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel stands in front of dozens of fans, including a CUT FEMALE REPORTER with a NOTEBOOK labeled WIRED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the 9/11 pager message leak will have huge privacy implications.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel beams. It's INFECTIOUS... the reporter is SMITTEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wired wants a longer piece, can you make time for a one on one session?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Call me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him a CARD and exits, crossing with Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at you. With groupies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a reporter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's certainly working an angle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel laughs. We hear the RING of a CRYPTOPHONE and foll the sound past happy revelers to Julian, with Birgitta an few CUTE HACKER GIRLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian notices the cryptophone's RING, picks up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (INTO THE PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Julian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowd chants, SCREAMING, FIGHTING with police. A MAN in the foreground presses a phone to his ear, WEEPING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (INTO THE PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian... I have horrible news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian GRIPS the phone, listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He PALES and we PRELAP --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (PRELAP, ON CLIP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The victims, Oscar Kamau Kingara and John Paul Oula had worked closely with the Kenyan Commission on Human Rights on a report documenting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A MONITOR, a KNN CLIP of the crowd fighting poli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ON CLIP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...complicity of the Kenya police in over 400 murders. The report gained local notoriety after it was published on the Wikileaks site...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL Birgitta and Marcus staring up at the screen. Juli VERY UPSET, hovers over Daniel, typing on a laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This can't be some mealy mouthed press release. Kibaki killed them, the language needs to be stronger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's already pretty strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the damn computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian, IRRITATED, takes over, pushing Daniel out of the way. Birgitta sees how upset Julian is, leans in to comfo him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This wasn't your fault. They left their names on that report, they wanted the world to know they stood behind it. They knew the stakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian keeps typing, FRUSTRATED...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, they wanted the world to know. It's an astonishing story, we put it on the front of the damn website and we couldn't get a single paper outside of Kenya to pick it up. (then, upset) We're not breaking though. They were my friends and I... if we'd gotten that report more publicity, they'd have been heroes. Murdering them would have had a political cost, Kibaki wouldn't have dared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a tyrant, Julian, I don't think more publicity would have --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning on him, HARSH) What the hell do you know about publicity? Outside of self- promotion? Sucking up to reporters, it's disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman from Wired?   I was selling her a story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you leave that to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian grabs the laptop, stalks off. Daniel stands, NUMB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't take it personally.    He's scared. You should be too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (catching his tone) Our operating system is secure, our other sources are safe, we're okay. Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus doesn't look impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think the site is vulnerable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're taking on Presidents and Kings and kingpins -- people who can afford to hire the kind of Black Hats that get off on breaking into a so called secure operating system. And, believe me, if your O.S. is anything less than secure, it's not gonna take long for them to I.D. the rest of your sources and hunt them down... to say nothing of what they'll do to you and Julian. (then, serious) Ask for my help, Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Daniel, FREAKED, convinced Marcus is right --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A plane arcs through the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Wikileaks commemorated 9/11 by publishing a half million pager messages originally sent on the tragic day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now WE SEE the letters, UNITED STATES OF AMERICA. And the wing, the SEAL of the SECRETARY OF STATE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small conference room with an empty video screen. Sarah Shaw, on the phone, eyes a monitor broadcasting CNN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many have hailed the messages as a fresh level of insight into 9/11, a vital addition to our historic record...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (INTO THE PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay. (pause)    Yeah. Keep your man on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah HANGS UP. An OPEN FOLDER is on the table, a PROFILE JULIAN. As she eyes it, an AIDE walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted the Deputy NSA?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah nods and the aide pulls up a SECURE VIDEO CONFERENC On screen, we see SAM COLSON, 32, perennially impatient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ON THE VIDEO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought if I sent you to Cairo I might get a minute to myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LONG TABLE, several computers, TV monitors, military display screens. Surprisingly quiet, a small skeleton cre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ON VIDEO DISPLAY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn on CNN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah is on a DISPLAY beside the long table... which is empty, save Sam. He flips a TV to CNN, sees the 9/11 stor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This the site that skewered Palin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the Iranian nuclear program, Petroperu, Bank Julius Baer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...right, we just indicted the bankers. These guys have an agenda?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truth, justice... the American way. (then, pointed) They got the 9/11 texts from someone monitoring the top pager services.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colson pauses as it DAWNS on him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think they got the leak from us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CIA's concerned, they've put a man on it. And we think it's time to get the Pentagon involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pentagon? This is a website, right? Not a terror cell. Let me call Justice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diplomat JAMES BOSWELL enters, cool and calm as in the OP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justice will tell you there's a first amendment issue. And even if there weren't, the site has mirrors outside the US, it's beyond the law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even know what that means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means information transfer is too damn easy and we're not prepared. Call the Pentagon, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boswell ends the video conference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had it under control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. (sits, all business) We're a half hour out of Cairo, you want to brief me on this source?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah reaches for a folder marked SECRET. She opens it, w see a PHOTO: SIM SARNA from the open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off the photo --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FAMILIAR ROCKET by new signs: 26c3 - CHAOS COMMUNICATIO CONGRESS - HERE BE DRAGONS - DECEMBER 22ND, 2009.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELECTRONICA HUMS and a LIGHT SNOW FALLS as we PUSH INTO -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (PRELAP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The program code is a mess, the OS has massive problems...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lobby is crowded with hackers registering for 26C3. I corner, Marcus huddles with Daniel, Birgitta and Julian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and there are ways to trace your sources -- they aren't protected nearly as well as you say they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Daniel, agitated) You let him on the primary server?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He could have hacked it himself. That's the point. We need help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to be careful who we trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian glares at Marcus, it's awkward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian, I've known Marcus for years. We knew Birgitta all of five minutes when you asked her to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I asked her. I have experience with these things, I don't make mistakes. At least not usually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The implication is clear. Daniel's STUNG. And UPSET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We make a promise to our sources...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made a promise to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian's angry. But more than that, he's HURT. BETRAYED. OTTO, the volunteer from the last Congress, walks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might wanna get backstage, a couple of guys are sniffing around, real Patriot Act types...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otto nods towards two blond men in suits by the registrat desk. WATCHING THEM. They're calm, PROFESSIONAL. The team TENSES, Julian quickly packing up. Birgitta leans in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel is right. You have real enemies, no need to make ones up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian considers as APPLAUSE and CHEERS take us INTO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is the same as two years ago but the contrast is ENORMOUS. A ROWDY CROWD of HUNDREDS cheer Julian and Dani

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to The Guardian we've had more scoops in three years than the Washington Post has had in thirty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel clicks a pointer. A MAP OF THE GLOBE, leaks appear by country, a presentation more polished than any we've seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...we've exposed corruption in dozens of countries...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, we see Julius Baer and Scientology, but there's al the Petroperu oil scandal (Peru), the Natanz nuclear cove up (Iran), and toxic dumping by Trafigura (Cote d'Ivoire)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel catches Julian's eye, a moment of shared amazement they realize how much they've accomplished. WE HEAR a LOW HUM... PULL BACK... it's the AUDIENCE. ON ITS FEET. CHEERING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's POWERFUL. As the cheering fades and the audience sit an EAST BERLIN WOMAN moves to a microphone in the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I grew up in the East. We... if we even wrote a letter about a broken sewer pipe, we were watched. Maybe interrogated. Thrown in jail... (her eyes welling) I think, Mr. Assange, that if we'd had someone like you... the wall would have come down years before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to say whether it appeals to his vanity or his altruism, but Julian is clearly moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, security. That's the essence. Security guaranteed by anonymity. (working something out) Of course, as much as you try to protect, there will always be those who seek to destroy. But we, we make a promise to our sources...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian glances over at Daniel. An admission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...which is why we're continually adding qualified partners to strengthen our team. (and then) You can change the world with a good idea... but you can't do it alone. You need people... willing to put themselves on the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Julian, looking at Daniel --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men and women barter in the crowded, ancient BAZAAR. We notice a FALAFEL PLACE at the edge of the market...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I copied it from memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A HANDWRITTEN DIAGRAM of the Teller-Ulam NUCLEAR BOMB... the same diagram as we saw in the Open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're testing the explosive in the next six months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL a tense SIM SARNA with Sarah at a corner table in dingy falafel place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. We thought they were at least three years away from a bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. It's grim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had such hope this summer. Even after Mousavi lost and the Basij broke up the marches, you could still feel something in the air. The protest letters, the 'death to Khamenei' graffiti in the very heart of Tehran, it was unimaginable ten years go. But if Khamenei gets the bomb, if he succeeds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sim trails off, upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember that New Years party in Sharm el-Sheikh? I'd just started my Fulbright, I had a bit to drink --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot to drink --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shida begged you to go home but you stayed. You hardly knew me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone had to keep an eye on you. And on that short Egyptian doing the bad Omar Sharif impression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles. Then looks at him, POINTED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DC's a nice place to raise a child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you believed in reform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she does, but...) You have a family now. I want you to do what's best for your family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) You know, they say that if a boy is not given a proper kebab before he hits puberty he'll lose his manhood. Tell me, where have you had proper chelo kebab outside of Sa'adat-abad? (then) Tehran is our home, Sarah. I am doing what's best for my family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah reacts. A beat, then she notices a WAITER taking an interest. Cool and professional, she changes the subject.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...so how are Shida and the baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Sim, switching gears --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The aftermath of a very successful talk, a LARGE CROWD hovers around Julian. Reporters, fans, groupies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd love a bio piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian, are you still taking speaking engagements?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about in kind donations? Routers, USB sticks...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian moves up the aisle with his entourage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes, just e-mail Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. Look at the PayPal account.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus and Birgitta fall in with Julian, eyeing a smartphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...it's thousands of euros. We can upgrade servers, get new laptops...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we find some mistletoe and celebrate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian smiles at Birgitta, IMPISH. She rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you guys at the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian looks over, sees Daniel... with his PARENTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. and Mrs. Berg. Daniel didn't tell me you were coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel clearly didn't know. He's less than thrilled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We kept reading about you in the papers. Can you join us for dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian's busy, I'm sure he can't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking Mrs. Berg's arm) I'd love to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small cottage in a sleepy suburb of Berlin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (PRELAP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was taken in Belgium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cozy living room. Mr. Berg brings a coke to Julian, who looks at one of many FRAMED PHOTOS on the mantle, 16-YEAR-OLD DANIEL in a JUDO ROBE, with a TROPHY and his BEAMING PARENTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all went?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I organized the competitions. We traveled to Dusseldorf, Geneva...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember that boy he beat in Prague? He was so big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel and his mother walk in with cheese and bread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She means he was fat. And slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian STARTS. There's a CAT. It HISSES at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schmitt. Leave him alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian looks at Daniel. The cat is named Schmitt? Daniel shrugs as his father reaches for a stack of LOCAL PAPERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, have you seen these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been keeping all your articles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was this one piece on Julius Baer in the FAZ. It was wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls the paper out of the stack, holds it out to Juli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't really bother with local press.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a national paper. It's so impressive, what you've done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian forces a smile, looks past the paper to the BOOKSHELF. Kropotkin, Chomsky. He turns to Daniel's fathe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's some collection. Quite the anarchist, hmm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel's father gives a small shrug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the oddest thing. I didn't meet my biological father until I was in my twenties. I walked into his house and on the shelves, Kropotkin, Kafka, Solzhenitsyn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian pulls down the Kropotkin. Daniel and his parents watch, frozen, as Julian stares at the book, OBLIVIOUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...all the books it had taken me years to discover on my own...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's AWKWARD. Not knowing what to say --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps you'd like to borrow one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tossing the book aside) Where's the bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel nods. Julian grabs his backpack and heads off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes his backpack to the bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (awkward) Security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But as he says it, Daniel catches a glimpse of a backpack and turns to see Julian HEADING OUT THE DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Daniel --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like two years ago, East Berliners of all sorts in the ca club. But unlike two years ago, Julian's SURROUNDED by WO and GROUPIES. He's holding court, soaking up the attentio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian turns as we FIND Daniel. Standing there. Pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, lost my appetite. You have to admit, they're a bit suffocating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian heads for a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't picked up on that? Well, I suppose we each have our own unique way of looking at the world. In fact, here's an interesting one --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian pulls out the copy of WIRED UK from his backpack, flips to the article. EXPOSED: WIKILEAKS' SECRETS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see it, the new Wired piece? (reading) Cofounder Daniel Schmit got involved with Wikileaks prior to launch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below the headline, there's a picture of Daniel. ALONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say that. (off his look) Julian, the reporter screwed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you're used to people exaggerating your successes. But while you were out winning judo trophies with Mutti und Vati, I was studying information systems in a shitty squat outside Melbourne, obsessing over code in a hot flat in Paris, holding schizophrenic meetings with myself: the Chairman, the Secretary, sole volunteer and founder of a website no one had ever heard of. Including you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Lovely speech, are you done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel starts walking away. Julian calls out after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off the Wired piece) He adopted the nom de plume 'Schmitt' after his cat. (then) To think, I spent weeks reading Horace searching for the right nom de guerre. If only I'd had a cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian tosses the Wired article at Daniel, turns back to groupies. As Daniel stands there... a KID we might recogn as ZIGGY, the 17-year-old from the OPEN, walks up to Juli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the leak guy, right? From the Congress? You need volunteers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have hundreds of volunters... but we can always use loyal followers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. I'm Ziggy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ziggy enthusiastically shakes Julian's hand. Julian pulls him in, eyeing Daniel... who turns to the bar, ORDERS A DRINK. Daniel POUNDS it, then TURNS BACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees Ziggy and two hot women FAWN OVER Julian... As Julian whispers something to Ziggy, Daniel orders another drink. He POUNDS it, then TURNS BACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group laughs with Julian... laughing at Daniel? As th cute blond STARTS TO TRIM JULIAN'S HAIR, Birgitta leans in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a reporter here from The New Yorker? He says you agreed to a profile?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian turns. A YOUNG INDIAN REPORTER waits in the door. As Julian beckons him over, Daniel orders another beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel POUNDS it, then TURNS BACK. He sees Julian, still holding court, the reporter now taking notes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was divorced once. There was a terrible custody battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...stressful?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen my hair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ziggy, packing up Julian's bag, looks up, AWE ON HIS FACE And for a brief moment HE LOOKS JUST LIKE DANIEL DID WHEN MET JULIAN, no beard, no weariness in his eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel GRIMACES, POUNDS a last beer and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel hurries down the stairs, passing... Marcus, agains wall, with a GROUPIE or two, DRUGGED OUT OF HIS MIND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey man, five minutes, I just need a cup of coffee, I'll be clear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushing past him) Don't worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Julian wants me to drive you guys to the airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian can go fuck himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads down the stairs to the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Marcus, CONFUSED --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diplomats walk up jetway stairs onto a LARGE 757 marked w the SEAL OF THE STATE DEPARTMENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PRELAP --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...should be a smooth flight back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diplomats board the plane. On a TV monitor, C-SPAN plays speech the Secretary gave earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (OVER THE PA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to Washington this evening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think this is good intel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIND Sarah seated with Boswell, looking over Sim's diagra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've known Sim for twenty years, he and his wife are like family to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Write up a cable, I want everyone on the Middle East Desk up to speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah nods, opens her laptop, pulls up the State Departme NET CENTRIC DIPLOMACY DATABASE. She starts TYPING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN ON THE CABLE. We see an ID NUMBER, a SUBJECT (IRA NUCLEAR CAPABILITY REPORT), and a CLASSIFICATION (SECRET)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Type fills the TEXT FIELD: In a conversation with Iranian physicist Sim Sarna (STRICTLY PROTECT)...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HOLD ON the words STRICTLY PROTECT as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The foyer of a familiar apartment, small but WARM. We HEA WOMAN on the phone in another room. Just as we start to recognize her voice, there's a KNOCK at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anke walks in cradling the phone. She looks at her watch, surprised -- it's late, she clearly wasn't expecting anyo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the door, she peers into the peephole. Then REACTS. An opens the door. Daniel stands with his bags. EXHAUSTED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands there, PRAYING she'll let him in. A beat, then Anke reaches out, PUTS A HAND ON HIS CHEEK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a finger tracing a HUGE WIKILEAKS TATTOO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never thought I'd fall for a rock star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL Anke and Daniel, naked. Anke runs her finger over WIKILEAKS TATTOO that SPANS DANIEL'S BACK. Daniel smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think rock stars have cooler tattoos. You should have heard Julian...  (imitating him)  'Compensating for something?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be happy to tell him you're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling, then)  I didn't care. It wasn't for him anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's an asshole, Daniel. He's a manipulative asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must be. Why else would I have given up everything I cared about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a new job, too. (then) We consult with the legislature... push for transparency, citizen participation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a smile) Sounds familiar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but we try to work with governments instead of terrorizing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did see your talk, though. (off Daniel's surprise) I spent the past year thinking about you, I wanted to know if it had been worth it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks skeptical. But she reaches out to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you've done, it's staggering. Julian didn't create that alone. The two of you, you're a team. Sure, he's the mad prophet, there's one at the heart of every revolution. But that's why most of them end badly. (and then) He needs boundaries, Daniel. He needs a line. You're the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. Daniel gives her a wry smile --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I had this fantasy about driving into the Alps and spending a month naked in front of a fire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close your eyes, I'll turn up the heater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she moves to kiss him, we PRELAP --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Investigative journalism is pricey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small room of elite reporters. Nick Davies at a podium, banner above: 2009 SKUP INVESTIGATIVE JOURNALISM CONFEREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When papers get squeezed, it's first to go. That's why providers of first rate source material like Wikileaks are so important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, is Assange ever going to show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing at his phone) It seems he's been delayed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passport control is such a bore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room turns as Julian walks in with a number of BAGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently, they're not such fans of first rate source material.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives the crowd a SMIRK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the crowd LAUGHS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reporters fill a hotel bar. REINDEER PELTS on the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were CIA agents on my plane. That's the real reason I was late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIND Julian at a table with Nick and an ATTRACTIVE FEMALE REPORTER (ALEX LANG). Julian's flush, almost giddy, embellishing for Ms. Lang. She eats it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An international man of mystery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I've worked that line. Next he'll tell us these 'spooks' kidnapped his partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian stares BLANKLY at Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The German fellow, Daniel. The grounded one, who helps you distinguish fact from fiction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ms. Lang, blithe) We have hundreds of volunteers.    I can't keep track of them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, do try to keep track of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles at him, heads off to the ladies room. As Julia watches her go, admiring, Nick changes tone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what is this new leak you're sitting on? Must be big to have piqued the CIA's interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian turns. Somewhat surprised --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You believe me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't til I noticed your friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick nods to TWO MEN in the corner, WATCHING THEM. Julian BLANCHES. It's the BLOND SPOOKS from the BCC. He starts t RISE, but Nick puts a hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not attract attention, shall we? Besides, the American spooks are civilized. It's the Russians you need to keep an eye on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick glances over at TWO THICK RUSSIANS talking quietly a the bar. AND WATCHING THEM. Julian follows his gaze, ASHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Room 376, can you remember that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian nods. Nick discreetly slips him a KEY, then stands

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Ms. Lang returns, bring her up. They'll assume you're in for the night, which should leave ample time for us to find a way to slip you out of the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And for you to show us what it is that's got their knickers in such a twist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel and Anke sleep. Daniel looks peaceful, more conten than we've seen him. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His cryptophone RINGS. Daniel BOLTS UP, eyes FLASHING ope Anke stirs as he checks the caller ID. He looks to her... she already knows who it is. She nods and Daniel picks up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A well-appointed European hotel room. A FRENETIC Julian paces beside Nick, who watches VIDEO on a laptop. In the b/g, Ms. Lang is on a hotel phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you, can you be on the first plane to Reykjavik tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE DO NOT SEE THE VIDEO, but we HEAR the HISS OF A MILITA WALKIE. Nick watches, STUNNED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus... I'm surprised they don't have more men on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (INTO THE PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were in Norway--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't stay here, it's not safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll have a taxi here in twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Lang hangs up the hotel phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be by the back stair, the Americans are out front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian, what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick stands. Off the video --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, this is going to be... Julian, you should work with us on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, so the Guardian can take all the credit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian a BALL OF ENERGY, takes Lang's arm, walks her into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian pulls Ms. Lang into the small bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (INTO THE PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Julian HANGS UP the phone, closes the bathroom door behind Ms. Lang and PULLS AT HER DRESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She STOPS him. It's not an unwelcome advance, but under t circumstances, Ms. Lang is SURPRISED. He explains --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'm going to slip out of the hotel, I'll need a disguise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't help but smile. And OBLIGE, pulling at her ZIPP the SOUND morphing into the ROAR OF AN AIRPLANE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An AIRPLANE cruises in for a landing, flying over a RED VOLKSWAGON BEETLE that's pulling out of the airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure no one's following us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Daniel, in the front seat. He trades a look with Birgitta, who's driving, then peers into the REARVIEW at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian, in back, IN MS. LANG'S DRESS. Looking a bit crazy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel's phone RINGS. He checks the caller ID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Nick from the Guardian. (then) Julian, what is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Julian's nervous smile, we SMASH TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON GRAINY MILITARY VIDEO from IRAQ. A HELICOPTER CA on A GROUP OF MEN near a building on a dirt road. The cam pans OMINOUSLY. We hear AMERICAN VOICES over MILITARY RAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ON THE VIDEO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just fuckin', just open 'em up. Let's shoot, light 'em all up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, we hear MACHINE GUN FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAT-TAT-TAT-TAT -- the camera SHAKES. A small time delay then the men DUCK, and FALL. SHOT. DUST rises around them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep shoot'n, keep shoot'n.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAT-TAT-TAT-TAT. The smoke CLEARS and we see DEAD BODIES the ground. It's GRAPHIC, DISTURBING. So is the language.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at those dead bastards. (laughing) Nice. Nice. Good shoot'n.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL Birgitta, Daniel and Marcus in a hotel room, watch what we now know to be the COLLATERAL MURDER VIDEO. STUNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. Were they even armed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With cameras, mostly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian stands behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two of the victims were Reuters news employees, a photographer and his driver. The Military claimed they died in a battle between US forces and insurgents and the press just bought it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't Reuters chase the story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pentagon completely stonewalled them, it's a massive cover up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian, this is huge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick thought so, I bet we could sell it to the Guardian for millions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to sell this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian's considering it. Marcus and Birgitta look APPALLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course he doesn't. And we won't have to. It'll spark a whole new wave of donations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel holds Julian's gaze, then pushes on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's assuming it's legitimate. Where did you get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guy showed up in the chat, said he was US Military. (following Daniel's lead) But we'll want to track down the families of the victims.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Baghdad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, in Baghdad. We're journalists, we have to verify sources, maybe you should look into flights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ziggy SWALLOWS HARD. Julian watches Daniel with RENEWED APPRECIATION as he takes over, turning to Marcus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to pre-process, improve resolution...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can probably use FFMPEG...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll grab some more volunteers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the team springs into action, we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a MONITOR. A quote over black -- 'Political language is designed to make lies sound truthful and give the appearance of solidity to pure wind.' George Orwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Now add some buzz over that, radio frequency, military comms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL Daniel, Birgitta and Marcus and some volunteers making edits to the video. Daniel spots Julian out on the patio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian stares out at the otherworldly landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to set up a media launch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel walks up. Julian's a bit lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard people say that I dangle somewhere on the autistic spectrum. It's probably why I lean so heavily on those around me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small admission, it seems heartfelt. But this time, Daniel's not quite susceptible, not really moved --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. So the media launch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ziggy's planning something at the Parliament building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ziggy...  (off Julian's look) You want to launch the biggest leak we've ever had in Iceland?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian's momentarily flustered. Daniel pats him on the ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's take the fight to them.  (heading back inside)  Courage is contagious, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Daniel exits, we HOLD ON Julian, who realizes what he means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Julian UNNERVED and IMPRESSED, we SMASH TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun glistens off the CAPITOL DOME as WE PRELAP --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The video shows the brutal slaughter-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian speaks to a room of REPORTERS, photos behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...of two Reuters reporters... US soldiers clearly debased by war...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A SMALL TELEVISION. WOLF BLITZER on CNN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The video was released by the whistleblowing website wikileaks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL Anke, standing with Daniel, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose there's something to be said for terrorizing governments...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel smiles at her as Blitzer continues, a large screen playing the beginning of the Collateral Murder Video.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you're about to see is graphic--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK CUTS of the Video. We see the men mowed down again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pentagon correspondent BARBARA STARR speaks to Wolf Blitz

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the army found no one at fault, that the helicopters in the air had no reason to believe there were journalists on the ground...
