dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK CUTS of the Video. We see the men mowed down again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pentagon correspondent Barbara Starr speaks to Wolf Blitz

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nonetheless it is a grim reminder of the nastiness, of the terrible things that do happen in war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megyn Kelly interviews MILITARY ANALYST CAPTAIN CHUCK NAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's calling this collateral murder. Captain, is that a fair description of the job our troops are doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah and Boswell watch FOX NEWS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...if you are embedding with terrorists and they're engaged and you get killed, it is not murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want ugly pictures, you should get out of ugly wars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That decision's a bit above our pay grade, wouldn't you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got Deputy NSA Colson for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah hits the SPEAKERPHONE, her tone changing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (INTO THE PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 12 million people have seen that video on You Tube, you still want to tell me it's just a little website?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colson on a phone outside the press room, working note pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Thomason has been reviewing all the intel, he's fielding a tiger team, I told him to pull you in. (then) I'm on in five, you got anything for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy on Fox is pretty good, maybe you should use some of his material.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, it's Jim. Tell the press the truth, those soldiers were following protocol, this is computer geeks looking at the war through a pin hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those computer geeks are becoming a real menace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the revolution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boswell starts to leave, crossing with an aide. The aide hands a NOTE to Sarah. She scans it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boswell stops, turns back. And sees Sarah's PALE. As we wonder what exactly the note says, we FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FADE UP ON a GOOGLE SEARCH on Julian Assange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MOUSE clicks stories, WINDOWS pop up. Washington Post, Wall Street Journal, New York Times. Quotes are read --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Assange is disheveled.' 'Like a bag lady.' 'Changes cell phones daily.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL Julian with his bags, TWO LAPTOPS open, HEADPHONES on, a MOBILE ROUTER beside him. He talks to one of the laptops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few days of serious analysis then it's all about how weird I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN OVER the SCREEN: he's SKYPING with Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus is plugged in; Ziggy and a few staffers swirl arou Daniel talks to Julian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you had to enjoy Keller's diatribe on your filthy white socks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I just never figured brutal slaughter and my socks would get equal billing in The New York Times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel smirks as Julian's cryptophone RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Julian answers, Daniel's cryptophone rings. And sudden ALL THE OTHER PHONES IN THE ROOM ARE RINGING. Daniel turn SURPRISED, when HIS COMPUTER STARTS BEEPING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down at the screen -- TWENTY IMs HAVE POPPED UP. Every one of them about a Private Bradley Manning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same thing must be happening on Julian's side because STARES at his screen, his face going WHITE. Then, NUMB --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're going to kill us... (then, to Daniel) Get off skype, get off everything now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Daniel's Skype goes blank, Marcus starts BARKING --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to shut everything down! You all have five seconds to save!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel turns. Marcus is WILD EYED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus, what the hell is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five... Four... We can't let them trace us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus hits a button. All the computers freeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? Marcus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus hands him a laptop. On the frozen screen, an artic in WIRED: 'U.S. Intelligence Analyst Arrested in Wikileak Probe.' A photo of Manning, something about 260,000 U.S. diplomatic cables... As Daniel reads, Birgitta RUSHES in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just spoke to Kim Zetter at Wired, she said the US Military arrested a private for leaking secrets to us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The video? This is the guy who leaked us the video?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (upset, pale) She said it was more than that. Half a million classified US Army documents. And hundreds of thousands of internal communiques from the U.S. State Department. (then) She called it the biggest leak of classified information in history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel STARES at a PHOTO of BABY-FACED PRIVATE MANNING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus closes the laptop and we SMASH TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian whispers to a young PRIVATE in a US ARMY UNIFORM. HUGE STACK OF DOCS TOWERS nearby... SOME MARKED U.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The private turns to look at Daniel... we only get a glim of his face... IS IT MANNING?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Daniel, we SMASH TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a cryptophone. RINGING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a door open and Anke walks in with a bag of GROCERIES. She reaches for the phone, answers. Light --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calling on the cryptophone, must be serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't hear what Daniel says, but Anke PALES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel's on his cryptophone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..Wired broke the story, the soldier seems to have told someone online...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearby, Marcus types furiously, bringing them back online Birgitta and the staffers huddle around a MONITOR, readin about Manning. UPSET, SCARED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bragged about it in a chat room? What the hell was he thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's 22. He's just a kid. (to Marcus, nervous) Are you sure they can't trace us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus doesn't look so sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm adding another Tor circuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he starts typing faster, we PICK UP Daniel --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (INTO THE PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you need to wipe my portion of the hard drive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anke's totally freaked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (INTO THE PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have those files?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not answering) You need to go to your mother's, do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frightened) Daniel, if you have those files and they know about it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (INTO THE PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I've got to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel hangs up. To Marcus, urgent --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we back up yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus works a laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a few more proxies... (pissed, reeling) The goddamn mission is to protect sources...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't protect sources from themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus' computer BEEPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're online.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See if Julian's on the chat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus types into his Desktop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [AS BEFORE, a CHAT BUBBLE appears on Marcus's laptop and THE BOTTOM OF OUR SCREEN]. mArc: Hey. Back online. You there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian's cramped into a COACH WINDOW SEAT, his LAPTOP ANG AWAY from the passenger beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS' CHAT pops up on his computer screen. He glances WARILY at the passenger next to him... then TYPES. [In th scenes we see him silently typing, reacting to the chat]. jjj: We need lawyers for Manning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They trade a NERVOUS look. Marcus reaches forward, TYPES. mArc: So it's true? We have the docs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian KEEPS TYPING. jjj: Creating a temp website, will send you the link.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. He's got them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did he not tell us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus shows him the screen. jjj: We need to publish everything. NOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Daniel. VERY CONCERNED --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah and a YOUNG STAFFER, late 20s, hustle down a corrid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're telling me this private stuck a thumb drive in a computer and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a CD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a blank CD. It was marked Lady Gaga.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah STARES at the staffer as they walk into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILITARY BRASS, SUITS, everyone's on phones. Sarah joins Colson, conferring with a GENERAL (THOMASON).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the Secretary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim's calling her now. Do we know which documents Manning leaked?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's refusing to talk but we think it's war logs from Afghanistan and Iraq. And cables from the NCD database.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which cables?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Thomason looks down, EMBARRASSED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which cables?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He may have leaked the whole database.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That database has over a quarter million cables. Appraisals of world leaders, sensitive information on dozens of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then it HITS her. APOPLECTIC --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, there are names. Insiders, informants in every country, people whose lives will be at risk if...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She trails off, OVERWHELMED. Thomason turns to Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are informants named in the military logs as well. Hundreds of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colson reaches for a phone, TENSE. Sarah, NUMB --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 22 year old private with a history of mental instability and a Lady Gaga CD and we're on the verge of a major international crisis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (INTO THE PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need the AG, the Joint Chiefs, whoever's running Wikileaks for the CIA and anyone else who might have a clue how to crush these assholes. (to Thomason) In the meantime, let's hope to God they're more responsible with information than we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over this, Julian's chat POPS UP on the bottom of the scr jjj: How fast can we format the US docs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPLIT-SCREEN as before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Birgitta and Daniel stare at the laptop open to the chat, Marcus works on the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, it's three gigs of text.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus pulls up a SET OF CABLES on the second laptop.   Daniel stares. The words STRICTLY PROTECT jump out at him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel eyes Marcus, who's seen it too. He looks NERVOUS..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel, this is crazy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel glances back at Julian's text: How fast can we for the US docs? Trying to remain CALM, he dictates to Marcus

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him we can't dump the data, tell him it's too dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus starts TYPING.

dialogues.speaker: SPLIT-SCREEN
dialogues.text: mArc: Can't dump data. Too dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian REACTS, VISIBLY ANGRY, starts BANGING on the keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel dictates feverishly, Marcus types...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him we need time to go through it all, tell him that once we've...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they stop as Julian's chat FLIES ONTO THE SCREEN. jjj: MORE dangerous NOT to publish. jjj: once it's out, there is nothing they can do. jjj: AND. if we don't publish, what message does that send? jjj: find our source and you can stop us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the damn keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel leans over Marcus, bangs on the keyboard ANGRILY. ddd: this is RECKLESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian reacts as Daniel's chats fly across the screen. ddd: we don't know what's in the docs. ddd: you're putting people's lives in jeopardy. ddd: this is not the mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, you disloyal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The passenger beside him looks at Julian, UNEASY, as Juli POUNDS his keyboard, livid, CLOSING the chat window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SPLIT SCREEN ENDS and we SMASH TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel and the others STARE AT THE SCREEN. STUNNED. jjj has logged out of the chat room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He logged off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of silence, then they're distracted by...

dialogues.speaker: FOXNEWS
dialogues.text: Who gets hurt from this? The American people and the national security of the United States. And the way to deal with this is pretty simple. We've got special ops forces, a dead man can't leak stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn see Ziggy staring at his laptop, FREAKED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) That's their house liberal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel's phone RINGS. NUMB, he eyes it, picks up. COLD --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick. How can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a an EARLY EDITION of tomorrow's Guardian, a BIG PICTURE OF MANNING on Page One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can put me in touch with Julian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL Nick holding the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian's not available.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel, we both know you're sitting on the biggest story on the planet. And if you're thinking of going to ground on this, I'm afraid it's too late. Genie's out the bag, cat's out of the bottle, all the old cliches apply and now Manning's future and yours will be defined by one thing - how this material is handled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel STRUGGLES, eyes the text of the chat with Julian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to tell Julian, I'm already working on a story to paint this as the next Pentagon Papers, but you need our help. This is bigger than anything you've done, you think they spun you on Collateral Murder, wait 'til you see what they do here. Tell Julian there's credit enough to go round, this is about survival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel's TEMPTED, they do need help... but he's not ready

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get back to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel hangs up and turns to Birgitta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Julian flying into?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian walks out of customs. He ANXIOUSLY scrutinizes the men and women around him. From his PARANOID POV, they all seem suspect... they all seem to be STARING AT HIM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, from behind, a HAND REACHES OUT FOR HIM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian spins, FREAKED. It's Birgitta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did anyone follow you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I... I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian pulls his hat low, spots Daniel waiting with a car beside other drivers. He turns on Birgitta, accusatory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you to come alone. (looks around, panicked) They're looking for us, they've got people everywhere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian, you need to hear him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Julian, AGITATED, darts into the airport train entran

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train slowly snakes through the flat Belgian countryside. Glinting in the moonlight. Ominously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel Ellsberg put out a statement, he said they're coming after us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel, Birgitta and Julian talk in HUSHED TONES on the relatively empty train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to publish now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian, it's hundreds of thousands of pages of sensitive material. This isn't like the video, the docs are full of jargon, they're totally impenetrable -- we wouldn't know what the hell we were publishing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we let the historians figure it out. Isn't that the point of this organization?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought the point was protecting whistleblowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train stops, the doors open and Julian spots COPS walking on the platform. Panicked, he sees... the car's SURVEILLANCE CAM trained on them. Angry, scared, he glare at Daniel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...then RUSHES off the car as the cops step on and casual sit down. OBLIVIOUS. Birgitta, SPOOKED, looks to Daniel.. who PULLS OUT HIS PHONE. And DIALS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Davies, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing his arm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel, we bring him in, we're going to lose all control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we already have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Daniel, we PRELAP --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a political battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick calmly peels an orange at a cafe overlooking the cit Birgitta, Daniel and Julian, hat PULLED LOW, sit across t table. ANXIOUS. And SKEPTICAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get me wrong, you should keep an eye out for men with poison umbrellas, but if the US has any foresight they know they need to do more than kill you. You represent a terrifying future, they need to delegitimize all you stand for, the most powerful media machine on the planet is right now planning a smear campaign like none you've ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazing how someone can talk for ten minutes without saying anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick glances over at Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you'd hear him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wary) What are you proposing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An international media coalition. The Guardian, The Times, Der Spiegel, all standing with Wikileaks, legitimizing you as a news organization. Let the US attack, we print the news. And if we put you on the moral high ground, up with Mother Theresa and Nelson Mandela...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one'll be able to screw with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian considers, SWAYED. A beat, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd want exclusives?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finding stories in all those documents will be a lot of work. You can't expect us to do it without an incentive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then what, we'd set a date? You'd run your stories, we'd post the raw data?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pausing) I'm assuming the documents contain names? Sources? US informants?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks over at Daniel. Daniel nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd need to redact them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think that's necessary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guardian can't condone publishing something that could put lives in danger. And morals aside, this speaks to how you're perceived. You're starting an information war with the US Government, you mustn't hand them ammunition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose it's just a name search.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian seems SWAYED. Nick's phone RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my editor, what should I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How secure are your phones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick gets it. He stands, picking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan, I'm afraid it's a complete screw up. No, he won't talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nick hangs up, Daniel leans in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian, this could be historic. The Guardian, the New York Times...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll take credit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the stories they find. But think of what that'll do for us. You want to break through, this kind of coverage gets people's attention. It could be the culmination of everything we've done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right, Julian. If you work with us, you'll have a golden trumpet, a Jericho horn, walls are gonna come tumbling. And when they do, you'll be atop an empire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This gets through. Julian jots something on a NAPKIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a password for a temporary site. I'll e-mail the link in 24 hours, you'll find the war logs there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we have a deal? We publish, you publish? We redact, you redact?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding)  We'll put out the war logs in six weeks. If you behave, we'll move on to the cables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Julian pushes the napkin across the table, we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan's meeting with a NUMBER OF EDITORS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning everyone, meeting's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick bursts in, sits at ALAN'S DESKTOP, pulls out THE NAPKIN. As he starts tapping away, Ian looks to Alan CONFUSED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan nods. The editors all stand and file out, save Ian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call Keller at the Times and whatshisfuck at Der Spiegel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A website with the WIKILEAKS LOGO appears on Alan's computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll know in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ian looks over his shoulder. A file starts downloading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty slow for a tech wizard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said it's 91,000 logs from Afghanistan alone, I imagine it might take a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan looks skeptical as his secretary HELEN walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan, I'm sorry, I told Nick --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, look at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick SMILES, turns the laptop to Alan. Who reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen, could you ring up Bill Keller for Alan? And let's be discreet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen looks at Alan mystified. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about going after their infrastructure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a screen, SECURE VIDEO. A window of Thomason at Pentagon and one of Colson and his staffer in the Sit Roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The site outsources storage to Amazon, takes donations on Pay Pal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIND Boswell in front of the monitor with a file, SNAPSHO OF JULIAN AND DANIEL at the BCC, on the Brussels train...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get Bezos on the phone. And whoever the hell is running Pay Pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really want us pressuring the private sector to cut off a journal--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not a journalist, he's a goddamn threat to national security and American companies shouldn't be helping him store thousands of stolen classified documents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PISSED, Boswell snaps off the video and turns to find...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN with a HAND TRUCK adding to a HUGE TABLE STACKED WI DOCUMENTS marked CONFIDENTIAL -- the compromised CABLES. realize this is the room from the Open - before the chaos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's STAGGERING. Boswell sees Sarah reading through cable

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are the compromised documents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is just the cables. They're going through the war logs at the Pentagon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reacts, then) We've got some people coming to help you out with these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't respond. Boswell sees she's SHAKING, a cable her hands. WE SEE the words SIM SARNA and STRICTLY PROTEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's named in dozens of them. If they go out, if the Iranians see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah. We got some intel yesterday. There are newspapers involved, responsible ones. The Guardian, The Times. They'll black out the names.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Sarah, hoping to god he's right, we hear the FIRST NO something like The Stones' Gimme Shelter and we SMASH INT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reporters work on large desktops. We hear hushed tones --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spreadsheet is enormous, I'm sure it contains the scoop of the century but we can't access it, let alone analyze it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARK, the German editor from the OPEN, walks Daniel in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're working in excel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stark nods as they reach ROSENBACH, the reporter from the Open. He looks up from his computer, BLEARY EYED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel, thank god, every time I open the damn thing the system crashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you need to parse it in a text editor then script it into a searchable database.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel sits down, starts working. As Daniel TYPES, Rosenb turns to a SKYPE VIDEO CHAT open on a nearby laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you getting this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC PULSES and we CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An AMERICAN REPORTER at a laptop in a small, MESSY room o similarly FRENETIC reporters. Two men carry in a SHREDDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that helps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WAR CORRESPONDENT arrives, just off the plane from Kabu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I blew off a profile with McChrystal in Kabul, this better be good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BEARDED REPORTER holds out a pile of WAR LOGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what'E.O.F.' stands for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The War Correspondent stares at the docs, his head EXPLODING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's 'Escalation of Force.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bearded reporter writes down EOF = ESCALATION OF FORC on a 3x5 card, then holds it up to a laptop with another open SKYPE VIDEO CHAT. We see IAN KATZ on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you see that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ON SKYPE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MUSIC SMASHES US TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The biggest of the bunkers, packed with reporters. Ian tu to a group at a WHITE BOARD covered with MILITARY ACRONYM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EOF is escalation of force. Which I believe means more dead civilians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a reporter writes it up on the board, WE HEAR --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The espionage act? You can't be serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN OVER TO a LAWYER talking with Alan, Nick and Julian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the Attorney General can show he tried to convince a source to leak classified information --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean like every journalist who's ever covered the Pentagon? They could indict us under that rubric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't be surprised if they do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan BLANCHES. Julian shoots him an IMPISH look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing draws people to a cause like a celebrity martyr.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you e-mail a list of whistleblower prizes you're putting Manning up for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We SPIN ACROSS THE ROOM to Ian, now skyping with Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ON SKYPE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No e-mailing. But I can fax you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, of course. We need it by Friday so we can run it in his bio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MUSIC SMASHES US INTO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel sits at the laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will do. Thanks, Ian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel turns from the laptop, starts to type on a desktop Behind him, Stark looks at a story Rosenbach works on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This task force 373 had a hit               list with over 2000 names?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, they refer to it as stopping birthdays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reporters start to work in a FRENZY, EXCITEMENT BUILDING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got the UK ambassador saying the campaign isn't under proper supervision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These civilian casualty       numbers are devastating...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel keeps typing as the MUSIC SWELLS and TIME SPEEDS U Behind Daniel, we see, in RAPID SUCCESSION...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOURNALISTS COME AND GO. We hear snippets, pan to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE WHITE BOARD. ACRONYMS APPEAR. HA = Helicoper Assault NAI = Named Area of Interest... TILT DOWN TO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAGES FLY OUT OF THE PRINTER. PICTURES of American troops combat, every HEADLINE staggering. Someone grabs a page -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel stops typing, EXHAUSTED. He turns to take it all i everything SPEEDING UP TO A BLUR AROUND HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN ON DANIEL, OVERWHELMED. A huge leap from storage closet calls to Julius Baer. They've come so far so fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANIEL CLOSES HIS EYES and RUBS THEM, DIZZY. A beat, then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time SCREECHES BACK TO NORMAL and the MUSIC FADES. Daniel OPENS his eyes, finds himself in a chair in Stark's offic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can sleep here if you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stark smiles. Daniel, sheepish, starts gathering his thin as Rosenbach walks in with a file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T minus 4, you getting excited?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Daniel has MIXED FEELINGS. Rosenbach picks up on this

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel, no one's ever had this level of detail... this is going to be massive, you guys should be on top of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel nods, but still looks NUMB. Stark turn to Rosenbac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must be exhausted. Hell, the redactions alone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They trade a smile. Daniel catches it. He's CONFUSED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...they shouldn't take that long. It's just a name search.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what we initially thought. but a lot of it is context. Nick told Julian -- a tip from 'the goat herder in the red house,' in small villages, it's as damning as a name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're only posting a few hundred of the actual logs and we're swimming. You'd need an army to go through all 91,000. Good thing you have one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another smile, but Daniel's FROZEN. PROCESSING. The MUSIC SWELLS again and Daniel grabs his cryptophone, DIALS. He holds it to his ear. A beat then we hear someone pick up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus, did Julian tell you anything about the redactions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC drowns out his answer, score SCREAMING over Daniel' HORRIFIED expression, telling us everything we need to kn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan and Nick show Julian the soon to be famous headline: MASSIVE LEAK OF SECRET FILES EXPOSES TRUE AFGHAN WAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The story on the generals would typically be the lead, but everything's going out at once in case there's a gag order...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're struggling to keep it to 14 pages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian nods to Ziggy, sitting with a laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talking point for the morning interviews.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ziggy starts typing, DANIEL BURSTS IN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian looks up, SURPRISED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been trying to reach you for hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was... I was just sending you a list. Urls need to be standardized, torrents need seeding...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian. The redactions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian pauses. CAUGHT. Then, covering quickly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was on my list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's 91,000 documents! There are four days until publication!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian hesitates, then ABRUPTLY turns to Ziggy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and BLOWS OUT OF THE ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian heads for the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell were you thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian turns, ENRAGED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Editing reflects bias. We make a promise to our sources, someone sent us those files under the assumption that we would put them out in full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel recognizes the words. He feels sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lied to them. You lied to all of us. (then) We're going to have to push back, we can't release in four days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea what we're about to do? 14 pages in the Guardian, 12 in the New York Times, it's more coverage than all the other leaks combined. I'm winning the information war and you're worried about a couple of names?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a couple of names, it's people's lives, Julian. Those are human beings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're government informants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sources, just like ours, fighting for the very things we were supposed to stand for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no idea how the world works. How much Afghan blood do the Americans have on their hands?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought this organization had higher standards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian pauses. Then turns cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My bags, you know, they get heavy. Four laptops, all those cables... it's a lot for one person to carry around. And when you're on and off planes, always taking the computers out and packing them back up... it's a hassle. (then, sharp) So the next time you find yourself lecturing me about this organization, you should try to remember why I hired you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny, I don't remember you hiring me. I don't recall a contract... a salary. But I guess I should have known when I met Jay Lim... they don't exist, because this organization doesn't exist. There's just you... and the lies you tell to get whatever the fuck you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian turns on him. A tinge of sadness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's amazing how you can spend so much time with someone and still have no concept of who they are. (then) You're suspended. Effective immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian exits with Ziggy. Off Daniel, STAGGERED...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN to Nick, who's seen most of it. A CONCERNED LOOK, his new optimism fading as CHAT BEGINS STREAMING UP OUR SCREE jjj: There must be faith in leadership in times of crisis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Daniel tries to pull himself together, chat takes us t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel is on the phone. On his laptop we see MARCUS ON SKYPE... and an OPEN CHAT BOX. jjj: Manipulation by Daniel to undermine me is not tolerable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay. Thanks, Marcel. (hangs up, to Marcus) Rosenbach said the bulk of the identifiable sources are in the threat assessments. It's 14,000 docs, but if you hold those, there are a lot fewer names in the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We leave Daniel, CUTTING INTO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Living quarters. Marcus works his laptop, Birgitta nearby

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JayLim: For any organization, leadership must have ability to take sanction against opportunism and destabilization

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We shouldn't publish any of it until it's been redacted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We CUT BACK INTO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel STRUGGLES. He knows Birgitta's right. TBellman: Daniel is problematic and frankly, delusional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you seeing the ridiculous crap he's spouting on the chat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you probably shouldn't mention that you were talking to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's out of control. If he keeps this up, he's gonna have to go. Or we're gonna have to fork. All of us. We can start our own site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just take care of those docs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel clicks off skype... nothing to distract him now fr the chat that streams across his screen and ours... Iclnd17: Daniel has a disease. It's some kind of borderline paranoid schizophrenia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now TWITTER FEED begins to scroll up the screen as well. Crypdois Schmitt is sick and dangerous, he has a disease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anke walks into the room, holding a laptop. UPSET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel... he's on twitter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TwitcheySphynctr Anke Domscheit = CIA, Daniel Berg = FBI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trh_humunculus RT @Crypdois: Schmitt is sick and dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These things he's saying, they're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel reaches for her, trying to comfort her and himself A beat, then he leans forward and pull up THE GUARDIAN SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Twitter and Chat FADE as Daniel CLICKS REFRESH. Sudde sweating, he PULLS OFF HIS SHIRT... We spy his WIKILEAKS TATTOO as MUSIC SLAMS US BACK TO THE OPEN --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan and Nick hustle past the row of one sheets...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off his blackberry) The Times wants to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel hits REFRESH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stark pleads with Nick on skype.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five minutes. Five more minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel hits refresh. And there it is on the Guardian home page: SECRET FILES EXPOSE TRUE AFGHAN WAR. COMPLEX EMOTIO play across Daniel's face as he turns to ANOTHER LAPTOP..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And pulls up the Wikileaks site. Afghan War Diary 2004-20 Wikileaks today released over 75,000 secret US military reports... As Daniel scans the raw reports... his jaw set

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONVICTION fills his eyes. He picks up a phone and DIALS, the tones waking Anke, who was sleeping on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding, into the phone) Marcus. How soon can you get to Berlin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC takes us through --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A series of quick cuts, the AFGHAN WAR LOG COVERAGE from OPEN, this time culminating in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ON THE MONITOR)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are names, operations, sources-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ON A MONITOR)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This leak puts American lives and lives of our allies in country at risk, there's blood on their hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL frantic staffers poring through cables as in THE OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a source in Colombia we're gonna have to extract.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, Putin's gonna go ballistic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two aides start to mark up the WHITE BOARD we saw in the OPEN as Boswell walks in, on the phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ON THE PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, still no intel on when they're planning to release the cables... Yes, we'll start right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boswell hangs up, walks through the CHAOS... until he fin Sarah, standing over a PILE OF CABLES. She stares at a MONITOR, CNN coverage of the afghan war logs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't redact the war logs... he put them right up on his site with names and... Jim, if he does that with the cables...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One hour, I need documentation on any sources that could be burned when he puts out the cables. Tell the other desk heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ON THE MONITOR)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Assange said his organization...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATCH CUT to a TV MONITOR with the same CNN coverage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ON THE MONITOR)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...has always had a harm minimization procedure to keep innocents from harm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL Nick Davies, watching the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, at least he kept part of the bargain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick turns, sees Ian walk in. He holds up a USB STICK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 250,000 diplomatic cables in the palm of my hand. Amazing isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan, eyeing copy, looks up. Ian tosses him the stick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bugger came through?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick was right, it's huge, a window into every government on the planet. Already I've found a dozen page ones. Qaddafi lying to his people, Putin stealing from Russian coffers, damning assessments of leaders in Egypt, Yemen, Tunisia...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick frowns, glances back at Julian on CNN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Still focused on yesterday's news?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The high priest of truth bragging about a redaction process that didn't exist? I don't think that's yesterday's news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, wasn't he your messiah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, just like all the others, with feet of clay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he's a liar. A callous little zealot... like every other oddball source.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventeen little keystrokes and anyone in the world can read what he publishes. And now that we've given him a goddamn megaphone, they will. (then, angry) He's not a source. He's a reckless, irresponsible head of a huge media empire that's accountable to no one. And we put him there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over Nick, we PRELAP SARAH, SPEAKING IN ARABIC --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (PRELAP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Sarna? Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Sarah, holding a phone. Two CIA MEN listen in, a third monitoring a digital readout of the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearby, Boswell, Colson, Thomason review a DOSSIER -- Sarna's photo, paperwork stamped STRICTLY PROTECT. On the long table, HUNDREDS OF DOSSIERS just like it. IN ARABIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember the trip we once spoke of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. Sarna's EYES GO WIDE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over this, WE PRELAP --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood on their hands?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a monitor, a TV Commentator on CNN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ON CNN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's ridiculous, there's no proof anyone was hurt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ON THE PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't about me, it's about the mission, everyone thinks that you're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIND Daniel, on the phone, LAPTOPS spread out on the desk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...hurting the organization...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian's phone BEEPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have reached the time limit. To re-record your message, press --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel HURLS the phone across the room. FRUSTRATED. A bea then there's a KNOCK. He moves to the door, opens it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you reach him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus bursts in. He pulls a laptop out of his backpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we both plug in, we should be able to do it while he's speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what? As Marcus sets up, Daniel glances at the TV. We our BBC Reporter in the press room of the Frontline Club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Assange dismissed reports of internal dissention and defections

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel frowns, opens up a chat box on his laptop. And TYP ddd: Julian? Are you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATCH CUT TO ANOTHER LAPTOP. A CHAT pops up in a CHAT BOX ddd: Julian? Are you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next to the chat, on the screen, STREAMING VIDEO CLIPS. P BACK TO REVEAL Julian typing a speech on another laptop. Katz walks in, eyes a bank of TV MONITORS nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a child, he went to 37 schools...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some call him a subversive. An anarchist...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ON THE MONITOR)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His hair is the result of a teenage science experiment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man points to the moon and the idiots look at his finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I suppose we'll have to give them the moon again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian smiles up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An AGITATED Sarna stands talking to his frightened wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to pack. Everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The KNOCK comes, THE TWO MEN IN SUITS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Sarna, TERRIFIED--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If journalism is good it is controversial by nature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus and Daniel watch Julian's press conference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a harm minimization process, we don't do things in an ad hoc way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel. We both know he's never going to step aside. If you want to do this, we need to do it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We push in on Daniel, INCREDIBLY UNSURE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to our knowledge no one has ever been physically harmed by the material we have released.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rubs his eyes, Julian's voice growing LOUDER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes two things to change the world. Lots of people have ideas. But commitment, true commitment, it requires sacrifice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now we INTERCUT WITH --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're BEHIND Daniel as he surveys the familiar room. Door open and shut, THOUSANDS OF LEAKS, STACKS OF DOCS pile up around the desks, waiting to be published.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move in on Daniel, PUSH IN on his back... until he turns LOOKS RIGHT AT US. A moment of CONFLICT, REMORSE, then he GRABS A KEYBOARD off a desk and HURLS IT at the LIGHTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As bulbs explode above him, SPARKS CASCADING DOWN, we CUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANKE'S APARTMENT, Daniel and Marcus at laptops, WORKING FURIOUSLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel looks PAINED as we CUT BACK TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SUBMISSION PLATFORM, desks now piled in the center of the room. Daniel STRIKES A MATCH...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLAMES shoot up, eerie light dancing across a SICK LOOK o Daniel's face as we CUT TO--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANKE'S APARTMENT, Daniel working, SCREENLIGHT dancing acr that same look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He plows ahead and WE'RE IN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SUBMISSION PLATFORM, the doors FALL, ONE BY ONE. As t do, Daniel grabs a STACK OF DOCS at his feet. A LEAK. He hesitates for a beat, a tear STREAKS down his cheek... Th TEARS FALLING, he TOSSES THE LEAK ONTO THE FLAMES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is role of good journalism to take on powerful abusers and when power abusers are taken on there's always a back reaction...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian speaks to the press, enjoying his moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...an attempt to criticize the messenger, to distract from the power of the message...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian hesitates, SOMEHOW SENSING SOMETHING AMISS. He loo to the audience... for Daniel? A bit disoriented... he presses forward, waving THE GUARDIAN FRONT PAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But revolution is a struggle between the future and the past. And... the future has just begun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As press stands, APPLAUDING, we SMASH TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two MEN IN SUITS who were outside Sarna's house sit i the front of their sedan. As they pull away from an AMERI CHECKPOINT, the driver talks into a phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've crossed the border into Iraq.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CIA men sit with a nervous looking Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you put them on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the car, the driver holds the phone out to... SARNA. W his wife and baby, huddled in back. SHELL SHOCKED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (INTO THE SPEAKERPHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved, fighting tears) You're safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do now? Where do we go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GLASS OF SCOTCH. REVEAL Sarah, NUMB, pouring a scotch, watching coverage of Julian's press avail. Boswell walks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Turkmenistan comment wasn't a hit with the Secretary, huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances at the BOX on Sarah's desk, and we notice for first time that THE DESK AND SHELVES ARE EMPTY. She's don

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, Berdymukhamedov himself called for my early retirement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure he called for more than that, but there's diplomacy for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's drink to that. At least while we still can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pours Boswell a drink, nods to Assange on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I watched an interview with him while I was packing up. He said something about pursuing social justice for the last twenty years, so I started thinking... 2 advanced degrees, a Fulbright, 3 diplomatic posts, 10 years abroad... and like everyone else in the building I can barely remember how old my kids are. (off Julian on TV) He wants to take over saving the world? Be my goddamn guest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Sarah, we SMASH TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large green room, filled with supporters and a high end spread. Julian walks in, reporters on his heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian, we'd like to do a follow up for Channel Four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glenn Brown, the Economist, we'd like a profile piece?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Contact us online, I'll have my press person get back to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUARD closes the door on them and Julian's MOBBED by th few YOUNG STAFFERS from Iceland with him earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was amazing. Genius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've got MAGAZINES, ALL OF WHICH HAVE JULIAN ON THE COVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see Time? Newsweek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got interview requests from Larry King, B Sky B...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Anderson Cooper, 60 minutes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian takes the magazines, but walks past them to Ziggy. Who's on his laptop. Looking CONCERNED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something wrong with the submission platform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian leans in, stares at the screen. He PALES, then reaches over Ziggy and starts to type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's disabled... it's completely... no one will be able to submit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he trails off, STAGGERED, we SMASH INTO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is in ruins, the lights dark, the doors down, t bonfire of burning desks ... Julian stands there. STUNNED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then he realizes... He looks up and sees... ALL THE DOCS, AFIRE... FLOATING AROUND THE BONFIRE OF DESKS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The leaks... The other leaks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They dance above him, LITTLE LIGHTS OF FIRE taunting him. Julian GRABS HIS HAIR, begins pacing, FURIOUS. BETRAYED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know he dyes his hair. I saw it once, we were at a conference and he went up to the hotel room and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel walks into a hotel room. The BATHROOM DOOR is cracked. Through it, Daniel sees a HAIR DYING KIT on the sink. Daniel pushes open the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON HANDS. Applying dye to a BLOND HEAD OF HAIR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cult he was in? The Family? They made the kids dye their hair white. I think he's been dying it ever since.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to REVEAL we're now in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small room. 13-YEAR-OLD JULIAN sits on a bed, toweling hair dry in front of a COMMODORE 64, a box of FLOPPY DISK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess everyone has secrets. Scars. Moments in time that shape them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls off the towel, revealing a SHOCK OF WHITE HAIR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian paces alone, ENRAGED, in the shadow of the bonfire We CRANE UP as he paces, making FIGURE EIGHTS in the sand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some we can get past...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and as we PULL BACK, we notice CHILDREN, dancing 'roun the bonfire, REACHING UP for the fiery, floating docs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some we can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cafe where Daniel and Julian took on Julius Baer. Dan stares at an empty table, and for a moment he sees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moment that shaped him, one he wonders if he'll get past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were really something, you know? We could have done so much...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE IMAGE FADES and Daniel looks down, DEVASTATED. REVEAL Nick with him, taking NOTES. He stops, takes off his glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, there was a time when papers in Britain couldn't report on parliamentary debate. And then a few men started printing pamphlets, leaking the debates to the public. The men, well, I believe they were hanged, but the public saw those pamphlets and demanded access. (then) Of course, the pamphleteers that followed overwhelmed our tiny isle with rhetoric and distortion... but these men, these brave and irresponsible men... they were the fathers of the modern fourth estate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel looks up. Nick leans in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The great flood is once again upon us. A new information revolution, this one infinitely more powerful and terrifying than the last. A... fifth estate... seemingly hell bent on destroying its predecessor. Which is why we need more responsible men... (off Daniel) ...men of purpose... to harness its power, to lead us into the future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel takes that in, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel, you and Julian gave us a glimpse of what the future could be. You woke up the world, democracies and dictatorships alike should be on notice, two techno dreamers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REAL FOOTAGE of the TUNISIAN AND EGYPTIAN UPRISINGS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have given us the voice, have shown us we have the power...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REAL VIDEO FOOTAGE of OCCUPY WALL STREET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to demand the waves of information that, one day soon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...will wash all their evils away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel takes that in. MOVED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. Where should we start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most good stories start at the beginning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel nods. Then, as he starts to tell our story, we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Text appears on screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In 2010, the Guardian and the Times published a series of articles on the US diplomatic cables. Activists around th world greeted these reports with great enthusiasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian sits for an interview, talks straight to camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not anti-American. Our values are those of Jefferson and Madison and if the cost of revolutions like we've seen in Tunisia, in Cairo, if the cost is that for a little while some foreign leaders are going to be a bit cautious when speaking to the U.S. State Department, then that is clearly a cost that bounces in favor of what people need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we continue, we INTERCUT THE INTERVIEW WITH TEXT CARDS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In 2011, over the objection of the Guardian, the Times and numerous human rights groups, Wikileaks published all 251,287 cables in their original form. Without redactions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By some estimates, the unredacted cables exposed over 2000 confidential sources around the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That has always happened in the history of the world. We are taking on powerful groups that have vast and powerful lobbies to support them. So of course we are going to be attacked in all sorts of manners. Of course people are going to try and capitalize and distort and hype up any sort of possible criticism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After Daniel left Wikileaks in 2010, Swedish Prosecutors issued a warrant for Julian's arrest, accusing him of two counts of sexual molestation and one count of rape. Julian claimed he did not know the women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My goodness. I know mainstream media is biased, but this is absurd. The charges are without basis and their issue is deeply disturbing. I have been warned that, for example, the Pentagon plans to use dirty tricks to spoil things for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian later admitted to having slept with both women, but denied any wrongdoing. He subsequently sought asylum and is now living in the Ecuadorian Embassy in London.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As an organization, clearly we've made mistakes. There are perhaps certain individuals -- an individual we employed that perhaps we should not have employed... That's probably the greatest mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After leaving Wikileaks, Daniel published a book about his time there. Wikileaks threatened to take legal action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was excitable. He became unstable, ambitious. Reckless. That's why he was suspended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In 2010, Daniel announced plans for Open Leaks, a new whistleblowing website. The site has yet to launch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wikileaks movie? Which one? (then) That one? It's based on the worst two books. Full of lies and distortion, like all bad propaganda. (then) The Wikileaks Movie? More like the anti-Wikileaks movie. (then) You want to know the truth? No one is going to tell you the whole truth. They'll only tell you their version. You want the truth, you have to seek it out for yourself. (and then) That's where real power lies, your willingness to look past this story, any story. As long as you keep searching, you are dangerous to them. That's what they are afraid of. You. It is all about you.
